Please mind that the staff@mastodon.social e-mail is for inquiries related to the operation of the mastodon.social server specifically. If your account is on another server, we will not be able to assist you. For inquiries not related specifically to the operation of this server, such as press inquiries about Mastodon gGmbH, please contact press@joinmastodon.org. Additional addresses:

  • Legal, GDPR, DMCA: legal@mastodon.social
  • Appeals: moderation@mastodon.social

Funding

This server is crowdfunded by Patreon donations. For a list of sponsors, see joinmastodon.org.

Reporting and moderation

When reporting accounts, please make sure to include at least a few posts that show rule-breaking behaviour, when applicable. If there is any additional context that might help make a decision, please also include it in the comment. This is especially important when the content is in a language nobody on the moderation team speaks.

We usually handle reports within 24 hours. Please mind that you are not notified when a report you have made has led to a punitive action, and that not all punitive actions are externally visible. For first time offenses, we may opt to delete offending content, escalating to harsher measures on repeat offenses.

We have a team of paid moderators. If you would like to become a moderator, get in touch with us through the e-mail address above.

Cross-posting

"Cross-posting" is the automatic copying of posts from one platform to another. That definition does not include the simultaneous posting to multiple platforms from the same app, such as Twidere or PostyBirb. If you use those apps, we consider those posts original, and the following need not apply.

When using Mastodon in conflict zones or other high-risk areas, it is particularly important to be aware of how you can protect your account and digital information. Navigating account settings is critical for human rights activists, journalists and others facing digital security threats. With the evolving situation in Ukraine.

  • You can review your post and account visibility under account settings

What to do about self-harm and suicide concerns on Mastodon

If you or someone you know is struggling or in crisis, you’re not alone. Use the contact info below to get help.

Hello! mas.to is a fast, up-to-date and fun Mastodon server.
info.full_description:
Help!

For information about Mastodon and how to use it, the documentation section of joinmastodon.org is a great place to start.

To report bugs or issues with the Mastodon software, or to suggest features/improvements, go to the Mastodon projects page on GitHub.

For any questions about the mas.to server send an email to trumpet@mas.to or visit our helpdesk (free registration required).

We have a page showing uptime and server status at status.mas.to

Donations

We run mas.to as a free service because we love Mastodon, but it costs us lots of money! If you'd like to donate towards our running costs you can contribute by buying Trumpet a donut. Or lots of donuts! Trumpet loves donuts.

Moderation

Moderation of this server is carried out by our volunteer moderators on a best-efforts basis, based on interpretation of content posted to the server against our published rules.

Our server block list is based on but not identical to the Tier 0 blocklist.

Welcome!

Techhub.social is a mastodon instance for passionate technologists.

Moderator team

  • @nicdex (Owner)
  • @Raccoon

    • Ownership, Funding and Transparency

    All that information can be found in our Hub page.

    Status

    Current infrastructure status can be found at https://status.techhub.social.

    Reporting harassment / content breaking rules / other

    Please report the user using the "…" button and then "Report". Include posts in the report it makes the moderator job easier.

    If it's not breaking the server rules or SPAM, please DO NOT report the content. If it's something that you don't like, in the "…" button you can also Mute or Block someone.

    Code of Conduct

    The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of techhub.social; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

    1. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:
      1. Excessive advertising
      2. Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
      3. Untagged nudity, sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions
      4. Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions
      5. Misinformation/disinformation, anti-vaccination spam
    2. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
      1. Racism or advocation of racism
      2. Sexism or advocation of sexism
      3. Casteism or advocation of casteism
      4. Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
      5. Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism
      6. Pornography
    3. The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
      1. Sexual depictions of children
      2. Content illegal in the United States of America
    4. Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviours:
      1. Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
      2. Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
      3. Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.

    These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

    Getting in touch

    If you have questions, a copyright removal request or anything else please get in touch with @nicdex or send an email to hello [ at ] techhub [ dot ] social.

info.full_description:
Welcome to Universeodon.com

Where the universe meets Mastodon :)

About

Universeodon.com is a space for all humans who have a little curiosity. The kind of person who enjoys edutainment, reads books, watches science shows and loves to connect with people who view the universe through wonder. There are no forced topics here, but I hope you will find scientists, engineers, philosophers, physicists, and connect with people who share similar interests & passions.

From exploring the universe, to exploring the world we all share - everyone is welcome here.

Whether you love music, movies, TV, sports, books or knitting or anything in between - We all live in this wonderful universe, and I hope to see you exploring your hobbies, passions, and interests with amazing people across the #FEDIVERSE - The Universe ;)

Community Support

Universeodon.com is community supported and open source. Plese consider making a contribution or joining one of our subscriptions to support us.

Federated Community

This service is community driven and runs on the Mastodon open-source platform. We're fully federated and connected to the over 10 million other people on the #fediverse.

Security

  • Backed up locally and offsite
  • https everywhere


Please note: It is important that you protect your account with 2factor authentication. You can set this up after you register.
Direct Messages (DMs) - These are just direct "toots" - They are not encrypted. Please only use DMs to send anything you just don't want broadcasted but is not confidential. (The developers are exploring end to end encryption here)

info.short_description: C.IM is a general, mainly English-speaking Mastodon instance.
info.full_description:
What is Mastodon?

General Information

C.IM is a general, mainly English-speaking Mastodon community.

We fully subscribe to and comply with the Mastodon Server Covenant. A number of instance blocks are implemented to comply with the principles of the covenant.

Our goal is to provide a long-term fediverse platform for everyone to share their thoughts, ideas and lifestyles.

Detailed rules

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of c.im; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

  • The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:
  1. Excessive advertising
  2. Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
  3. Untagged nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions
  4. Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions
  • The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
  1. Racism or advocation of racism
  2. Sexism or advocation of sexism
  3. Casteism or advocation of casteism
  4. Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
  5. Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism
  6. Spreading disinformation or conspiracy theories that undermine public health

You are encouraged to share your personal experiences here. But in doing so, please do not engage in personal attacks or make broad statements that attack/offend others - simply because of who they are. proposal by @fallingbeam

  • The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
  1. Sexual depictions of children
  2. Content illegal in the Netherlands (where c.im is hosted) or the Isle of Man (where c.im domain is registered), including holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism
  3. Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism
  • Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:
  1. Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
  2. Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
  3. Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.

These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

Most of our rules are forked from mas.to

Custom emojis are forked from EmojiALL

Media Retention

We currently keep local media files forever unless the user delete it.

We currently keep all remote media files for 90 days.

Donations

We have enough funds to run this instance, no donations needed.

Bot Accounts

Bot accounts are allowed, but you need to set the toot visibility to unlisted and mark your accounts to Bot.

The following bots are maintained by C.IM team:

  • @BBC

Soapbox

If you don't like the default Mastodon UI, you can try our Soapbox at https://fe.c.im/. Please note if you enable 2FA for security purpose, you can't use Soapbox. However, you can use the official Soapbox here.

If you don't like Mastodon, you can try out Rebased instance at c.wtf. Same site rules applied.

Lemmy

Relay Service

info.short_description: Hachyderm is a safe space, LGBTQIA+ and BLM, primarily comprised of tech industry professionals world wide. Note that many non-user account types have restrictions - please see our About page.
info.full_description:
Welcome to Hachyderm.io

Pronounced hack-a-derm like pachyderm. (What is a pachyderm?)

Non-User Accounts Restricted

Please also see "Note for Non-User Accounts" at the bottom of this page

Many accounts for non-users are restricted and/or invite-only on this server. This includes but is not limited to: companies, businesses, business-like entities, events, publications, projects, agencies, bots, and so on. Please refer to our Account Types Documentation and reach out to the admin team ( admin@hachyderm.io ) prior to creating an account if you are creating an account for anything other than yourself for personal use.

About

Here we are trying to build a curated network of respectful professionals in the tech industry around the globe. Welcome anyone who follows the rules and needs a safe home or fresh start.

We are hackers, professionals, enthusiasts, and are passionate about life, respect, and digital freedom. We believe in peace and balance.

Safe space. Tech Industry. Economics. OSINT. News. Rust. Linux. Aurae. Kubernetes. Go. C. Infrastructure. Security. Black Lives Matter. LGTBQIA+. Pets. Hobbies.

Community Links

Learn more about our Community by looking at:

  • Community Docs
  • Blog
  • GitHub Community Issue Tracker
  • 💞🐘Current Emojis 🐘💞

Funding

Hachyderm is funded via the Hachyderm project GitHub Sponsor page as well as other donation sources. Please see our Funding and Thank You documentation page for more information about additional ways to donate.

Moderation and Community Safety

Hachyderm is actively moderated to protect our most vulnerable members. Our primary rule is Don't Be A Dick and all other rules are to capture common "whataboutisms" that we want to clearly state are included by Don't Be A Dick. Our server rules, including Don't Be A Dick, are explained on our Community Docs.

When making moderation decisions, our moderators abide by our Moderator Covenant. This is to both hold ourselves accountable as well as provide transparency, and build community trust, around how we handle issues that might appear to fall into "grey areas".

If you experience an issue that needs moderator action / intervention, please look at our documentation page for how to report issues to the moderators.

Reporting Hachyderm Issues and Outages

Technical issues with the Hachyderm site, including full / partial outages and features that are not working correctly, need to be reported to us via our GitHub Community Issue Tracker.

New to Mastodon?

If you're new to Mastodon in general, we recommend taking a look at Mastodon.Help's brief explainer about what Mastodon is and isn't, as well as taking a look at fedi.tips for some How To Dos.

Note for Non-User Accounts

Also referred to as Specialized Accounts in our Documentation

Although regular user accounts are only subject to regular server rules, specialized / entity / "novelty" / "focus" accounts have some additional restrictions. To learn more, please see our Account Types documentation page. A short summary of what to know:

  • Company, company-like, and/or business accounts, currently known as corporate accounts, are invite-only. Unofficial corporate accounts will be suspended.
    • Anyone looking to create an account of this type must reach out to the admin team at admin@hachyderm.io.
  • Those looking to create accounts for non-profit entities should reach out to the admin team at admin@hachyderm.io.
  • Bot accounts are allowed with restrictions (please see our Bot Account documentation).
  • Qualifying Open Source Project accounts are allowed (please see our OSS Project and Community Events documentation).
  • Qualifying Community Events are allowed (please see our OSS Project and Community Events documentation).
  • Essentially: anyone interested in creating an account that is not a general user should reach out to the admin team at admin@hachyderm.io.
  • Large / Influencer account set ups and transfers, which is defined as more than 10k on any platform, need to reach out to the Admin team prior to transfer at admin@hachyderm.io.

For more information about all of the above, please see our Account Types documentation.

Unrecognized specialized account types will be suspended. Commonly suspended / unrecognized subtypes are:

  • NSFW / 18+
  • Fundraising
  • Unofficial company / corporate accounts

This is not an exhaustive list. If you are unsure if the specific specialized account you have in mind is allowed, please reach out to us at admin@hachyderm.io.

Our Logo

Our logo was designed by the lovely Ashton Rainbows. (website, Instagram)

Thank you Ashton!

Nivenly Discord

The Nivenly Foundation is the new (2023) parent organization for Hachyderm. You can join Nivenly's Discord here.

info.short_description: Mastodon Party is a general-purpose Mastodon instance, welcome to the fediverse!
info.full_description:
Mastodon Party is a new general-purpose instance open to everyone! If you appreciate my work, please consider contributing via Open Collective.

I've been a Mastodon instance admin and user since 2019, and I opened this instance to make sure there are more reliable general-purpose instances available for people to choose from during the great #TwitterMigration :)

Status Updates: Bookmark this status page: status.fediverse.us

Sponsors

This instance is generously supported by our contributors, if you use this instance to interact with the Mastodon network please make a monthly contribution on Open Collective, all support is immensely helpful!

If you would like to see your company's logo with a go follow link on this page, you can become a sponsor here.

New links on this page are added manually. We reserve the right to reject sponsorships if we believe the association could harm our brand. If you are not sure if your link will be accepted, reach out to jonah@fediverse.us.

General Information

Abuse / Harassment: If you are being harassed, please report the user using the "…" button and then "Report." Moderators may take any action they deem appropriate, such as a warning or an expulsion.

When reporting accounts, please make sure to include at least a few posts that show rule-breaking behavior, when applicable. If there is any additional context that might help make a decision, please also include it in the comment.

This server follows the Mastodon Server Covenant:

  1. We agree to active moderation against racism, sexism, homophobia and transphobia
  2. We agree to daily backups to ensure your data is safe
  3. We have backup administrators ready to operate this server in emergencies or my unexpected absence
  4. In the unlikely event this instance shuts down, we agree to give our users a 3 month period to migrate to another instance

As a general-purpose instance, we do not have heavy moderation in terms of what topics people are allowed to post about, however all users are expected to follow our rules at all times, and generally be nice and friendly on the federation.

Please report all content you see which might violate our rules for evaluation. If you are on a remote server, please forward any reports of our users to our server for our moderators to take action, we pledge that remote reports will remain confidential within our moderation team and will not be used for any form of retribution against the reporter.

Legal

Mastodon Party is operated by Fediverse Communications LLC, a Minnesota (USA) company, and is hosted on servers operated in Germany and Finland. All content on this server is expected to be legal in all of these jurisdictions. If you have any copyright, trademark, legal concerns, please email us directly.

  • DMCA Complaints: dmca@fediverse.us

info.full_description:
CMX.IM是长毛象(Mastodon)的一个中文实例。Mastodon 是一个开源的、符合 GNU Social 规范的去中心化社交网络，整个长毛象社区是由无数实例组成的。注册本社区后你不仅可以与本实例内的用户互动，并且可以与来自世界各地的其他实例中的用户无缝连接。

长毛象中文站是一个开放，友好，有爱的社区。长毛象中文站主题为喵、汪、各种动物、社交、科技、编程及生活。我们欢迎友好、热情、乐于分享的朋友，无论你的兴趣点是什么。

社区规则

这里不是圣斗士的角斗场，也不是犯罪分子的窝点。为了您安家后的使用体验，请详细阅读长毛象中文站社区规则。

如果你不喜欢本站的主题或发言规则，可以从Instance List中选择更适合你的实例。记住，除非你选择实例明确阻隔了其他某个或某些实例，你永远可以和整个Mastodon社区的用户交互。

使用指南

Mastodon 中文官方文档 (备用地址)

长毛象中文站博客

Mastodon 的去中心化设计防止了社交数据被少数公司或团体垄断的风险，也大大增加了屏蔽及过滤的难度。如果你有兴趣动手搭建一个实例，请参考官方文档。

你可以随时导出备份自己的数据并申请转移到其他实例中而无需担心因为实例运营者的问题导致的数据丢失。如果你有更多关于Mastodon的问题，请参考官方中文文档。

本站原则上只使用官方 Stable 代码，所有包括汉化等问题将在 Github 上提交。有编程经验的朋友不妨加入我们一起来让长毛象更萌，更可爱吧。

免翻墙备用镜像站

我们提供备用地址，特供不方便使用VPN的中国用户不需翻墙访问本站。请登录后在网页版的站内公告栏获取免翻墙备用地址与使用方式。

镜像站点域名使用特别说明：如果你的用户名为 example，那么 @example@m.cmx.im 是你的主ID， @example@cmx-im.work 是你的从属ID，备用ID不具备单独运作的能力。其他用户@你的从属ID可以解析到你的主ID。

表情包版权信息

  • 猫头鹰表情包 - 作者：微博 @咲沅沅沅沅

捐助与打赏

捐助本站运营所需的支出：

给管理员们买一杯咖啡：

Impressum

Martin Müller
c/o Postflex #3517
Emsdettener Str. 10
48268 Greven

Bitte keine Pakete oder Päckchen senden - Die Annahme wird verweigert!

E-Mail: helpdesk@troet.cafe

Verhaltensregeln

Wir haben für die Nutzung gewisse Serverregeln erstellt, die Ihr etwas weiter unten auf dieser Seite findet und die Ihr mit der Erstellung eines Accounts im troet.cafe akzeptiert. Bitte beachtet, andere Instanzen haben andere Regeln. Was hier erlaubt ist, kann dort verboten sein und umgekehrt. Wenn Ihr Verstöße erkennt, könnt Ihr diese über das Meldesystem melden. Bitte seit dort so genau wie möglich und gebt uns ggf. Zusatzinformationen, damit wir den Vorfall besser (und schneller) einordnen können. Damit helft Ihr uns. Bei Verstößen gegen die Serverregeln kann es zu einer Löschung der Beiträge und auch zur Löschung des verursachenden Accounts kommen. Bitte beachtet, dass es keine Rückmeldung gibt, was mit Eurer Meldung geschieht.

Server

Der Standort aller benötigten Server für das troet.cafe ist in Deutschland.

Serverstatus

Über https://monitor.martinmuc.de könnt Ihr einsehen, ob die Server derzeit erreichbar sind.

Backups

Aktuell wird von dem ganzen Server 1x täglich, mit wöchentlicher Rotation ein Snapshot erstellt. Zusätzlich wird der gesamte Mastodon Datenbestand und alle Konfigurationsdateien (Webordner, Datenbanken usw.) täglich verschlüsselt auf einen separaten Backupserver gesichert. Hier kommt ein anderer Backupserver als der Snapshot-Server zum Einsatz. Diese inkrementellen Backups werden für die letzten 7 Tage und dann jeweils 4 wöchentliche Backups gespeichert. DAS KANN SICH IN ZUKUNFT ÄNDERN Ich werde dies hier, oder über einen Toot mitteilen.

Spenden

Unter https://martinmuc.de/spenden erfahrt Ihr die Gesamtkosten für den Betrieb und könnt auch eine Spende an mich richten.

Hi! This is a general-purpose Mastodon server. It does not have any particular topic or target audience. Everyone is welcome to sign up as long as they are willing to follow our rules set out below.

In addition to the information provided below, we also have a blog and about page at about.ohai.social.

Support

The best way to get in touch for questions and issues concerning the server is through support@ohai.social.

Donations

We accept donations toward the operation of the server through Patreon.

Moderation team

There are currently three moderators for ohai.social:

  • @dee_in_calgary (she/her) 🇨🇦
  • @lutoma (he/him) 🇪🇺
  • @silsha (he/him) 🇪🇺

Server status

You can check the current server status on our monitoring page at status.ohai.is.

Security & Backups

This Mastodon server is hosted on bare metal in a data center in the south of Germany. Two people have access to the infrastructure, and all SSH access is exclusively using hardware security tokens. We will never sell or otherwise use your data for anything other than the operation of this Mastodon server, and we certainly do not read your DMs.

All database data is backed up twice daily in a physically different location from the live data (Specifically, at BorgBase).

In the unlikely event that we will ever have to shut down the server, we intend to give at least 6+ months of notice ahead of the shutdown.

Best practices

The list below is a collection of behavior that we expect to see from our users. If you see a user go against these best practices in a way that bothers you, please file a report and we will talk to them. While these best practices are designed to be guidelines for a good communal instance, repeated malicious unwillingness to follow the best practices will be considered just like breaking a rule.

  • In general, use the tools provided to foster a considerate and accessible atmosphere. This includes the liberal use of content warnings (especially on potentially disturbing or controversial topics), and alt-text captioning of media files.

  • When possible, provide credit for creative works in your posts that are not your own.

  • Uninvited comments about another user's personal choices, lifestyle or family are strongly discouraged and may be considered harassment. Inappropriate sexual attention, comments about appearance and implication of physical contact will not be tolerated toward any non-consenting user.

  • If you post sexual content or gore, use content warnings.

  • If you post advertisements, use a content warning. Advertisements should not be excessive or automated.

  • Bots may only interact with a user when they're invited by that user to do so.

  • Automated posts and high-frequency posts should be unlisted (rendering visible to everybody, but not appearing on the local timeline) to keep the local timeline of our instance a place of community dialogue and human interaction. This extends to bots, feed posters, Twitter "retweets" and Twitter crossposts with broken mentions ("…@twitter.com"). Crossposter accounts that stop being active participants in our community may be removed at the discretion of the moderators.

  • In discussions, please remain civil, do not insult the people you're talking to. Note that irony, sarcasm, or similar modes of language don't translate well to written language and tend to escalate discussions or misunderstandings.

(These best practices were inspired by the Terms of chaos.social and bsd.network. Thank you!)

info.full_description:
PLEASE READ BEFORE JOINING:

mastodon.art is a safe space instance. We have strict federation policies that protect our most vulnerable members first and foremost, which means we block any instances that host or platform hate (racism, transphobia, etc.).

Mastodon•ART — an inclusive community for creators that prioritises the safety of our marginalised members. We welcome all kinds of creativity: illustration, design, 3D modelling, gamedev, photography, music, writing, performance art, ceramics, typography, sculpture, fibre arts, and more! You're welcome to make •ART your main home on the Fediverse and are welcome to go 'off topic' to post your daily thoughts, witty banter, and friendly communication.

Please read •ART's Code of Conduct (below) and terms of use before signing up. Click here for a list of suggested Mastodon mobile apps. We strive to make •ART a safe and supportive community for everyone with a strong zero-tolerance stance on hate and bigotry. •ART has no ads or algorithms to mess with chronological timelines, and doesn't track you or profit off your data. Brands wishing to make an account here must be respectful by engaging with the local community. Accounts made solely to advertise will be suspended.

•ART is run by members of the community and is not a company trying to profit off of your life and art with ads. As such, your support via LiberaPay, Ko-Fi or Patreon to help pay for hosting and operating costs is greatly appreciated.

Mastodon.ART General Information

Mastodon.ART (•ART) is an independent community-run instance and is not affiliated with the joinMastodon.org (tootsuite) organization. The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administrators and moderators of •ART. They are listed here to provide you with an insight into the site and our moderation policies.

.ART's emoji credits can be found here

Moderation Team

  • @Curator (Instance Admin)
  • @TapiocaPearl
    • Ko-Fi: TapiocaPearl
  • @Eyeling
  • @L.J.Writes
    • L.J. would like to direct supporters here instead:
    > Support links for Indigenous disabled game dev & graphic designer evel: Ko-Fi, and Patreon
    > Support links for Black disabled artist Moo: Linktree and moneyyy.me
  • @Acolyte/Camilla
  • @Birdsong
  • @Aru
    • Ko-Fi: Queeroctopus
  • @ArtistMarciaX
    • LiberaPay: ArtistMarciaX

General Notice

  1. The following is not allowed on •ART: Unapproved bots, username squatting, registrations of famous trademarks/names (unless proof of identity is given). To be certain that your account isn't removed due to inactivity, be sure to upload an avatar and post at least once. Accounts without avatars or any activity may be deleted to free up registration space on the instance.
  2. Do not use •ART as a permanent back up or repository for your information, statuses, or media. Please keep an original copy of your work on your local machine, as Mastodon downsizes large file sizes. We cannot guarantee perpetual storage of your toots, information, or media on our servers. Please make a periodic local backup of your account to safeguard against possible data loss.
  3. You may move your account to another instance at any time by using the "Move to a different account" setting at the bottom of your Edit Profile page in your Preferences. You can also export your follow and block lists from the Import & Export page and import them into your new account to make the transition easier.
  4. You may delete your account at any time using the "Delete account" option at the bottom of the Edit Profile page. Keep in mind that federation of your statuses to other servers or search engines is beyond •ART's control — statuses, media and federated copies of your profile may remain elsewhere. Deleting your account is permanent, cannot be undone, and your username/content cannot be reinstated.
  5. We block or suspend many instances that do not adhere to •ART's ToS and CoC. Also, instances are intermittently and temporarily silenced during report investigations or when other instance moderators are not monitoring their users for any of the behaviours against our ToS/CoC.
  6. Please support the community by regularly boosting and positively interacting with other members.
  7. Mastodon.ART has a LiberaPay Account, a Ko-Fi and a Patreon if you'd like to support the operation and maintenance of our artistic community.

Code of Conduct

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of Mastodon.ART. These guidelines are here to provide you with an insight into the site and moderation policies because all members are guests here.

See our Cultural Appropriation Policy for handling reports of cultural appropriation in creative works on .art.

  1. All users, local and remote, are expected to adhere to the following principles:

    1. If you post someone else's work, you must credit the original artist/author, and must include some form of analysis or opinion on the work posted.

    2. Posting the same or similar content on multiple different instances (Fediverse servers) in order to spam local and/or federated timelines is not permitted.

    3. Respect other users' boundaries. Be respectful and sincerely apologize if someone informs you that a boundary has been crossed. Give people space if you accidentally push past a boundary.

    4. If you find yourself involved in a conflict and are worried about the situation escalating, contact @Curator or any of the mods listed above.

    5. Tag sensitive content such as violence/blood, graphic nudity, lewd content, and other potentially upsetting or triggering topics and hide them under a Content Warning (CW). CWs are a big part of the culture of the Fediverse, and CWing potentially upsetting content is how we keep our community and the wider Fediverse safe and supportive for everyone. (We also recommend people CW political posts, but we will not mandate it.)

  2. All users, local and remote, will be considered in the wrong if they participate in the following:

    1. Microaggressions ("not all men", white/man/cis-splaining etc.), ableism, deliberate mis-gendering

    2. Demanding education on problematic behaviour from a non-admin/moderator

    3. Skirting the lines of being a troll, or directly trolling

    4. Sharing DM screenshots or quotes from DMs or private communications publicly without all parties' permission

    5. Creating memes about someone without their permission

    6. Ranting or engaging in long rambling tangents on public timelines about a particular user without explicitly naming them (also known as "subtooting")

    7. Not tagging potentially sensitive or triggering toots

    This is not an exhaustive list, and all moderation decisions are ultimately left up to the discretion of our mod team. If any of these don't make sense, please speak with anyone on the mod team. We are more than happy to help you understand the problems with these kinds of behaviours.

  3. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:

    1. Corporate advertising and spam (does not include sharing links to your art-related income sites! You are allowed and encouraged to share your shop links, commissions info, donation sites, etc.)

    2. Unapproved news bots, post bots or follow bots

    3. Untagged/non-content-warned sensitive content (violence, gore, sexually explicit, etc.)

  4. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service (please also note that .art does not allow those known for harassing marginalised people off-platform to have an account on .art):

    1. Racism, sexism, or advocation thereof

    2. Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof

    3. Ableism; discrimination against those who are neurodivergent, physically disabled, or mentally ill; fatmisia

    4. Xenophobia and/or violent nationalism, or advocation thereof

  5. The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:

    1. Sexual depictions of minors, real or fictional

    2. Content illegal in Germany and/or France, such as holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism

    3. Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism

  6. •ART has a zero-tolerance mandate for harassment or bullying — your account will be immediately suspended.

  7. Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, impede other users from using the service, degrade the performance of the service, or incite others to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:

    1. Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.

    2. Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called "doxing") will be considered harassment.

    3. Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called "brigading" or "dogpiling") may be considered harassment.

  8. Please do not flood the local timeline. We define "flooding" as posting mutliple posts in quick succession to the local/public timeline (but the definition is flexible; judgements on flooding will be made in context). Flooding drowns out other users and annoys instances we federate with.
    • You can reply to the toots of others and banter back and forth as much as you want, as replies aren't shown on the local/public timelines.
    • Please avoid posting many pieces of art/media all at once. Sticking to one post per ten minutes (with one-four pictures attached) is a good baseline to follow. Please respect others' content and statuses so that they can discover other artists in the local timeline.
    • If you'd like to post long threads of many toots, consider marking the first toot as "public", and the rest in replies marked as "unlisted". This will allow users to click through the first toot to read the rest of the thread without flooding the local/public timelines.

  9. Regarding nudity/lewd/explicit content:

    It's considered good form to put nudity behind a CW as a courtesy for other users in the fediverse at large, and we encourage this practice. Recognizing the subjectivity of the matter, we consider this a recommendation rather than a hard rule where very light nudity with no genitalia showing is concerned, and we will approach any reports or complaints on a case-by-case basis.

    • Illustrative nudity and body/anatomy studies with very visible genitalia, and titillating / erotic imagery intended for mature audiences, are allowed on •ART, but only if tagged appropriately (ex. #lewd, #nudity, etc.) and marked as sensitive or placed under a descriptive content warning.
      • Tags are required so people have the opportunity to filter such content from their timelines altogether.
      • Descriptive text is required so that people can make an informed decision about whether to engage with the content behind the CW/image blur.
      • If you're unsure whether to mark a work as sensitive or post it under a Content Warning, consider the following hypothetical questions: Is it something you'd be comfortable viewing in a white collar work situation? Is it something you'd be comfortable being viewed by a minor? Would you happily show it to your parents? A no to any of these questions may require it being CWed/marked as sensitive. If you're still unsure, marking it as sensitive/CWing it is a good bet.
      • Another way to decide whether to mark a work as sensitive or post it under a Content Warning is to remember the Three B's: If your work features any Boobs, Butts, or Bits (genitals), hide that sucker!
    • Loli or sexual content with characters of questionable age, as well as 'ageing up' characters from fandoms that are minors in order to depict them in sexual situations, is expressly prohibited — your account will be suspended. (This includes cub porn.)
    • Nude photographs are only allowed if done in an artistic spirit — however, it still needs to be tagged and CWed/marked as sensitive. Erotic photography, pornography, or photography that puts too much emphasis on the genitals is not allowed, even if marked "Unlisted"/"Followers Only".
    • We understand that these things are subjective, but final interpretation of these rules are up to our moderation team.

  10. Gore, vore, and blood violence must also be placed under a descriptive content warning or marked sensitive.

  11. No NFT content. No advertising NFTs, no selling NFTs, no linking to off-platform NFTs or NFT content, no images connected to NFTs.

  12. AI-generated imagery (images generated by a neural network that has been trained using other people's work without their consent) is not allowed at all. Sharing links to external articles discussing AI imagery is fine, but if the article will place a preview of an AI-generated image in your toot, please place it behind a content warning.

  13. •ART's administration team reserves the right to refuse service to anyone, as well as to remove your data at any time due to inactivity of any duration (to help against future unmonitored accounts from being hacked and becoming spam bots), unethical use, or usage against •ART’s CoC/ToS. This includes repeatedly skirting the lines of rules in bad faith without explicitly crossing them, or without attempting to understand and respect the spirit in which these rules were written.

Copyright

All original content is copyrighted by the artist and cannot be distributed or used without prior permission by the artist. Do not repost or disseminate our artist's original content anywhere without their express permission.

Mastodon.art cares about your privacy and doesn't monetize or profit off of your personal information or art — your information is never for sale.

Federation Policy

  1. Federating with Mastodon.ART is not guaranteed. Links between federated instances are temporary and may change or disappear at any time.

  2. Other instances may not disseminate our users' original content or toots without credit and proper licensing.

  3. Other instances may not use automated means to analyze any derived work for publication or profit without •ART's users' consent. This includes serving ads next to copyrighted content originally submitted on •ART.

  4. Public toots are derived works that are protected by copyright.

  5. This instance honours noindex/nofollow and search engines are not allowed to index content from such users.

  6. Crawling the content of the instance and creating a database of its posts and content for the purposes of archiving, searching, or analyzing is prohibited. We value our users' privacy and their ability to control how their data is utilized.

  7. We will block, suspend, or silence any instance which permits any of the content or behaviour prohibited by this instance.

Hosting Information

•ART is fully hosted and managed by Masto.host.

An explanation of terms on our blocklist

Alt-Fedi - used when an instance federates with, associates with, and shares the culture of, instances that don't moderate (and in many cases, actively support) things like harassment, bigotry, hate speech, trolling, far-right ideologies, and generally abusive behaviour.

DNI - 'Do Not Interact'; instance hosts illegal content such as CSAM, loli, pedophilia, etc. If you want to verify these blocks, proceed with caution; use a VPN or an anonymous browsing service like Tor, and purge your cache afterwards.

Topics: game development and many related fields. We do all we can to make everyone interested in game development feel at home on this instance.

Code of conduct: gamedev.place/mastodon-coc.html. TLDR: be a sensible, nice human being. Harassment, insults, bigotry etc won't be tolerated.

Usage guidelines: gamedev.place/mastodon-guidelines.html. TLDR: it's mostly about game development. Preferred language is English.

This instance is ran by @aras; let me know if you have any issues or suggestions, or see inappropriate activity. Server costs are on me, and I'm not looking for help there right now.

Expectations

Rule Violations

If you find content that is in violation of the Server Rules, please report the account. You may also take action from your own account by muting or blocking the account, or the entire domain/instance.

We actively "defederate" masto.nu from other instances that are incompatible with our fundamental rules, in an effort to protect our users. This comes from reports of users but also community discussion around such bad actors. If you find another instance that you think needs to be restricted from interacting with ours, or if you feel that another instance may have been blocked by our staff in error, please reach out to our staff directly via DM.

Instance Staff

  • @mkevenaar@masto.nu (admin)
  • @Ludoviko@masto.nu (admin)
  • @geoffburke@masto.nu (moderator)

Server Covenant

masto.nu is working on getting listed on joinmastodon.org and we are working to implement all Mastodon Server Covenant fundamental expectations for instance administration. This includes things like active moderation, daily backups, multiple staff members, and a commitment to provide notice to changes in the status of this instance.

Following Norms

There are certain "norms" of Mastodon, and the wider "Fediverse" that you'll be expected to follow while a member of this instance. This includes the use of content warnings when necessary, and the regular use of descriptive text for image uploads. Some of these norms may be different than what you're used to on other platforms. While failure to use these these are not strictly moderation worth events, we do ask that you respect and try and conform to these norms as you explore and grow on the platform.

Our Discretion

We want to foster an open discussion where everyone feels welcome. The rules are meant to be clear and direct, but the staff of this instance has ultimate discretion on how they are enforced. We may alter to these rules as needed, but will make an effort to notify you of any major change.

If you are found to be in violation, the staff may take any action they deem appropriate, such as a warning or an expulsion from the server.

Your Account

You may your close account or move it to another instance at any time. You are in control of your identity and your social graph on Mastodon (and other federated instances) but the administrators here control your ability to use this instance and ultimately to interact with its users.

In addition to regular backups we make of our infrastructure, you can backup your data and export it at any time. You can also delete your account and your data at anytime. You can even schedule regular deletions of previous posts, if that's your thing.

Data Security

Unless it's required of us to investigate a reported instance of abuse of our policies, under standard operation we have no ability to regularly access your direct messages with other members of our platform. While this data is accessible with a request to our hosting providers database systems, we expect that to not be necessary except under extreme circumstances. Where possible we will notify you if such processes are taken for data associated by your account.

However, due in part to the open and federated nature of Mastodon instances, the Mastodon administrators of other instances you interact with may have access to your data.

While the connection to this site is encrypted, this is only the data in transit to you and to other servers in the federated network. The messages and data stored in the instance is not encrypted. This includes direct messages sent to other users of masto.nu! This is not a choice of the administrator, but a limitation of the Mastodon platform. Additionally, our hosting provider may have access to your data as part of the general administration of the server infrastructure.

You should use Signal, Matrix, or another E2E messaging app for the things you really want to be private.

Please review our full Privacy Policy for more information.

Trending Features

One of the key features of Mastodon is there's no sophisticated algorithm to drive more traffic to the site, or influence your thinking. Mastodon does offer hashtag, post, and link trending features that are based solely on observed activity within masto.nu and other federated instances.

Hashtags largely trend on their own without moderator intervention, but can be removed if they are abusive or disruptive. Some links will trend automatically if they're from mainstream or other sources known to be reputable. Some posts will trend automatically if they're from known figures with a history of appropriate content. Other trends are manually approved by our staff, and only removed if they are deemed inappropriate.

Funding

It is not required to pay for continued access to your account, but if you feel obliged to help cover the cost of running masto.nu, please visit one of our sponsor pages to help keep us going.



If we exceed the minimum goal then additional funding will be used to increase capacity, or to make periodic donations to Mastodon gGmbH and other groups supporting development of the platform.

欢迎来到o3o(嘟站)！这是一个泛话题社区，无论你的兴趣是什么，你都可以自由地通过发布“嘟嘟”来吐槽一切、摸鱼扯皮。 本社区由位于加拿大的O3O非盈利项目运营。我们相信由社会组织运营基本通讯软件和设施是必要的，它们不应被控制在大型企业和政府手中。

在这里，你可以通过发布“嘟嘟”来吐槽一切、摸鱼扯皮。无论你的兴趣点是什么，我们欢迎任何热情、友好、乐于分享的朋友们加入。请遵循互相尊重的原则，并遵守本站的《O3O主题或发言规则》。

本站点基于开源软件长毛象（Mastodon）建立。不同于微博或 Twitter，这是一个开源的去中心化社交网络。去中心化设计防止社交数据被利益集团垄断，也增加了屏蔽审查的难度。整个长毛象网络由上千个实例组成，这些实例相互连接，最终形成了一个庞大的网络，就像是一个巨大宇宙。每一个服务器都是宇宙中的一个星系，用户就是每个星系里的行星。你可以随时导出自己的账户并转移到其他实例中，无需担心因为实例运营者的问题导致的数据丢失。

请参阅《长毛象中文用户使用文档》了解如何使用长毛象。

捐助本站

o3o开放捐助通道啦，欢迎有能力的朋友酌情进行捐助，帮助我们维持服务器运营，继续打造开放、自由、有趣的长毛象社区！ 作为感谢，每一位捐助者都可以获得一枚 @ o3o.ca 域邮件地址以作纪念。请访问 捐助页面开始捐助或获取财务信息披露。

联系我们

如果无法通过站内私信联系站长们，可发送邮件至 admin[at]o3o.ca。

长毛象概念介绍

字幕翻译：Nebula



社区规则

为了您安家后的使用体验，请详细阅读O3O社区规则。

如果你不喜欢本站的主题或发言规则，可以从这里或这里中选择更适合你的实例。记住，除非你选择实例明确阻隔了其他某个或某些实例，你永远可以和整个Mastodon社区的用户交互。

使用指南

Mastodon 中文官方文档

Mastodon 的去中心化设计防止了社交数据被少数公司或团体垄断的风险，也大大增加了屏蔽及过滤的难度。如果你有兴趣动手搭建一个实例，请参考官方文档。

你可以随时导出备份自己的数据并申请转移到其他实例中而无需担心因为实例运营者的问题导致的数据丢失。如果你有更多关于Mastodon的问题，请参考官方中文文档。

本站原则上只使用官方 Stable 代码，所有包括汉化等问题将在 Github 上提交。有编程经验的朋友不妨加入我们一起来让长毛象更萌，更可爱吧。

NRW.social

Über Uns

Wir sind eine freundliche Mastodon Instanz aus Nordrhein-Westfalen. Ob NRW'ler oder NRW-Sympathifanten, jeder ist hier willkommen.

Verhaltensregeln

Auf nrw.social ist unsere Hauptrichtlinie:
→ "Seid nett zueinander!"

Leider ist das nicht immer so einfach wie es klingt, daher haben wir hier ein paar Punkte zusammengefasst, um dir einen Einblick in unsere Moderationsrichtlinien zu geben. Die endgültige Auslegung obliegt dem Team von NRW.social. Wir behalten uns das Recht vor, Toots zu löschen oder einen Account zu blockieren, wenn Probleme bestehen.

Respektiere, dass andere Menschen auch andere Gefühle, Meinungen und Erfahrungen haben als du.

Wir tolerieren insbesondere nicht:
  • Belästigungen, Stalking, Doxing oder Dogpiling
  • Hassrede, Rassismus, Sexismus, Beschimpfungen oder deren Befürwortung
  • Diskriminierung von Geschlechtern und sexuellen Minderheiten
  • Gewalttätige nationalistische Propaganda, Nazi-Symbolismus oder Förderung der Ideologie des Nationalsozialismus
  • Verbreiten von Falschinformationen
  • Aufrufe zu Gewalttaten
  • In Deutschland illegale Inhalte
  • Sexueller Inhalt oder Gewaltdarstellungen
  • Nicht markierter Sexueller Inhalt von fremden Instanzen
  • Nicht markierte, automatisierte oder übermäßige Werbung und reine Werbe-Accounts
  • Bots, die ohne ihre expliziten Anfragen mit Nutzern interagieren

Wenn du nicht mit jemandem interagieren möchtest oder einen seiner Beiträge nicht sehen möchtest, stehen dir Tools wie die Mute- und Blockfunktionen zur Verfügung. Bitte melde Verhalten, von dem du glaubst, dass es die Regeln verletzt. Das schließt Verhalten von anderen Instanzen mit ein.
Achte auch darauf was du postest. Toots auf Mastodon sind erst einmal öffentlich und das Internet vergisst nie! Wenn du nicht möchtest, dass jeder deine Beiträge lesen kann, verwende die Privatsphäre-Einstellungen.

Föderation

NRW.social glaubt nicht an Zensur. Fediverse ist ein Netzwerkdienst und die Aussetzung der Fediverse mit einem anderen Server wird nur als letztes Mittel durchgeführt. Sollten aber einzelne Instanzen dauerhaft entgegen unserer Regeln handeln, können diese durch uns stummgeschaltet oder gesperrt werden. Haben wir deiner Meinung nach eine falsche Entscheidung getroffen? Dann kontaktiere uns!

E-Mail-Anbieter

Eigentlich möchten wir euch bei der Wahl eures Mail-Anbieters nicht einschränken. Leider kommt es bei folgenden Mail-Anbietern zu Problemen, weshalb eine Registrierung (eventuell) nicht möglich ist:

  • gmail.com
    Da sich ein Großteil der Spam-Accounts mit gmail.com registriert, haben wir die Registrierung über gmail.com gesperrt. Habt ihr eure Mail-Adresse bei Google, könnt ihr bei der Registrierung einfach gmail.com durch googlemail.com ersetzen.
  • outlook, live, hotmail
    Leider sperrt Microsoft gerne kleinere Mail-Server wie unseren. Die Registrierungsmails können dann nicht zugestellt werden. Wir empfehlen euch generell einen anderen Mail-Anbieter zu verwenden, da nie garantiert werden kann, dass Mails die euch erreichen sollen, auch ankommen.

Backups und Verfügbarkeit

Es werden tägliche Backups der Instanz angelegt.
NRW.social wird privat in unserer Freizeit betrieben. Wir behalten uns vor, den Dienst jederzeit aus rechtlichen, technischen oder finanziellen Gründen einzuschränken oder zu beenden. Sollte dies der Fall sein, geben wir uns Mühe, dies mindestens 3 Monate im Voraus bekannt zu geben.

Serverstatus

Unter https://status.nrw.social befindet sich ein Status Monitoring für die Dienste von NRW.social. Ausfälle und Wartungsarbeiten werden hierüber kommuniziert.

Spenden

Wir stellen nrw.social werbe- und trackerfrei in unserer Freizeit zur Verfügung. Dafür fallen im Moment folgende Kosten an:

  • ein Root-Server für 129,47€ monatlich
  • die nrw.social Domain für 45,37 € jährlich

Wir machen das gerne und erwarten auch nichts als Gegenleistung von dir. Wenn du uns dafür trotzdem etwas zurückgeben möchtest, kannst du das auf verschiedenen Wegen tun:

  • liberapay via PayPal oder Stripe
  • ko-fi via PayPal oder Stripe
  • direkt per PayPal

Glasgow.social

About this server

Glasgow.social is a decentralised, free and open alternative to Twitter based on Mastodon. Part of the Fediverse.

Donations

You can donate to help us with server costs via liberapay at https://liberapay.com/glasgow.social/donate or visit our funding page to learn a bit more about how we operate.

Code of Conduct

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of mastodon.social; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

  1. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:
    1. Excessive advertising
    2. Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
    3. Untagged nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions
    4. Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions
  2. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
    1. Racism or advocation of racism
    2. Sexism or advocation of sexism
    3. Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
    4. Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism
  3. The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
    1. Sexual depictions of children
    2. Content illegal in Germany and/or France, such as holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism
    3. Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism
  4. Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:
    1. Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
    2. Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
    3. Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.
  5. Bot policy. Bots are welcome, but please include an owner/contact link and a description of what the bot does.

These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

Core values of ieji.de

Safety
Our strongest core value is to be a safe place for everyone, if we notice any kind of harassment coming from or going towards our instances,
the offending accounts are suspended without parole.

Security
We use the latest security technology to prevent sensitive data from being accessed from the outside with systems like CrowdSec and implementing the latest TLS standards. This includes not using Cloudflare at all as this would jeopardize your privacy as a huge MITM attack vector.
A sophisticated anti-ddos filter from CDN77 in addition to the well known Arbor Networks filter nullify most attacks.
Daily full backups of the database and a daily incremental backup of media files are being made towards a different datacenter within Frankfurt.

Performance
Another main goal is showcasing how fast mastodon can be by deploying it on the best highest clocking machine money can buy in a one of a kind european datacenter with active-active routing, the usage of CDN77s vast network and using a webserver which enables the latest webtechnologies like http/3, CASPer and quic (h2o).

Anonymity
The h2o webserver does not create any logs, Mastodon is being given a false IP (127.0.0.1) and we have a tor hidden service address with https enabled and a valid certificate from harica. Also accessible via Yggdrasil Network. These require acceptance of the tor onion cert. Also an early supporter of WirSpeichernNicht (german for WeDontStore), a movement against the data retention law that was planned earlier in Germany, pledging not to make logs.

Features
Whatever comes up as features at Mastodon, we implement it, we want you to have the best Mastodon experience there is, this includes:
Full Text Search via ElasticSearch, Translation Service via LibreTranslate and a relay service via AodeRelay, besides some relays, crowdsec and netdata, both very heavy focused on data privacy, no external services are being used.

Longevity
The service is online since may 8th, 2017 and is here to stay, also thanks to the continuous support from our community.

Ecofriendly
This instance is hosted at SYNLINQ which houses the servers in the modern maincubes FRA01 datacenter which only uses green energy and energy efficient cooling like the kyoto wheel.



Threads.net is blocked via domain block and iptables drop as the company has a horrendous past and does not at all align with our idea of privacy and safety.

Rules of ieji.de
Do not harass people in any way, no racism, sexism or transphobia allowed
Do not spread explicit pictures or copyrighted material
Do not break german law (no nazis or extremists allowed)
Do not use the account mainly to publish porn or spam
Do not post erotic content without content warning
Do not use the account mainly for advertisements or backlinking

Breaking rule one results in an instant suspension without parole.
Breaking the other rules will give you a strike or suspension depending on severity.

Bots are fine as long as they are useful

Tŵt is the independent, non-profit, community-led social network for Wales and the Welsh, at home and abroad.

Contact Us

  • Technical Support: help@toot.wales
  • Press/Media Enquiries: media@toot.wales
  • Legal/Regulatory/Compliance: legal@toot.wales

Covenant

Our promise to you: Tŵt will:

  1. Be available in Welsh and English
  2. Safeguard your privacy and keep you safe from bullying and harassment
  3. Be free of charge and never accept advertising fees

Our Core Values:

Follow friends and discover new ones. Publish posts, links, pictures and videos on a network that is community-owned and community-run.

Wales focus, Welsh moderated. All are welcome but our focus is Wales and the Welsh diaspora around the world. No global corporation can reflect our values, our language, our customs and our values better than we can ourselves.

Privacy. Tŵt ensures you can follow and be followed by the people you choose. Your messages (“toots”) can be seen by everyone or only the people you choose. Full account deletion is always available, and you can download everything you’ve ever shared.

Community Standards. Tŵt comes with effective anti-abuse tools to help you protect yourself online. Community moderators can provide personal help, and we offer a clear code of conduct.

Language equality. Our interface is 100% available in Welsh and English. If your computer or mobile device is set to Welsh, your Tŵt experience will be in Welsh. (Other languages are also available.)

No data mining, no corporate control. Tŵt allows you to consume the content you enjoy without interruption. Your feed is chronological and non-algorithmic – you decide who and what you want to see!

Learn more at our blog: blogs.toot.wales

Tŵt is proudly powered by Mastodon - open source social software. Join Tŵt and connect to the entire Fediverse of 15 million members (and growing) worldwide!

Tŵt Community Code of Conduct

  • Content Guidance

Governance

DEFCON.social provides for open discussion where different viewpoints are welcome. It’s not about how you look or how hard you meme but what’s in your mind, your ideas, and how you present yourself that matters.

We are a community where you can explore serious issues, ask dumb questions, tell the world what's on your mind and make friends along the way.

Please Note: - We have a strict Code of Conduct, insulting or harassing others is unacceptable. - We have a "No Nazi" policy where supremacist, intolerance, and edge lord behavior is unacceptable.

The DEFCON.social support website is here:
https://www.defcon.social

More information about us:
https://defcon.org/
https://reddit.com/r/defcon
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DEF_CON

ABUSE / HARASSMENT: If you are being harassed, please report the user using the "…" button and then "Report." Moderators may take any action they deem appropriate, such as a warning or an expulsion.

When reporting accounts, please include posts that show rule-breaking behavior, when applicable. If there is any additional context that might help make a decision, please also include it in the comment.

WARNING: If your account gets suspended (“Banned”) for violating our rules we WILL NOT reactivate your account so you can move your profile to another instance. Bad behavior that leads to a ban should not be rewarded by making it easy for you to move to another instance with minimal consequences.

Willkommen!

Herzlich willkommen auf ruhr.social! Dies ist eine Mastodon-Gemeinschaft rund um das Ruhrgebiet und die Menschen dort.

Spenden

Deutsch

Be excellent to each other. Wenn Du erwartest, von anderen freundlich behandelt zu werden, behandle auch die Anderen freundlich. Hier ist kein Platz für Hassreden oder für Nazis. Keine Bots im Allgemeinen! (nur nach vorheriger Genehmigung).

Du brauchst eine dauerhaft gültige E-Mail-Adresse zur Registrierung. Wenn Du 6 Monate inaktiv bist, wirst Du automatisch 4-mal (jede Woche einmal) per E-Mail daran erinnert, dich erneut über das Webinterface einzuloggen. Nach 7 Monaten Inaktivität wird dein Account unwiderbringlich gelöscht.

  • Helpdesk System
  • Wissensdatenbank

Oder Du bist sowieso schon bei Patreon, dann geht es auch dort:

English

Be excellent to each other. When you expect to be treated nicely by others, be nice & polite to others yourself. There is no place for hate speech or for Nazis on this site. No bots in general! (only with prior permission).

You'll need a permanently valid mail address for registration. If you are inactive for 6 months, you'll get a weekly reminder by mail for 4 weeks to login again. If you don't do so, your account will automatically be deleted after 7 months of inactivity.

Primary language on this server is German, English is allowed as well. Other languages have the problem that we cannot moderate it.

patreon.com/Windfluechter

info.full_description:
hessen.social

Wir möchten eine freundliche, sichere und inklusive Mastodon-Instanz für alle Menschen bieten, die sich unseren Zielen und Hessen verbunden fühlen. Hier möchten wir eine Umgebung schaffen in der sich Menschen freundlich austauschen und diskutieren können, ohne persönlichen Angriffen oder Stigmatisierung ausgesetzt zu sein.
Um dieses Ziel so gut wie möglich zu erreichen haben wir die folgenden Nutzungsbedingungen geschaffen, die wir auf dieser Instanz auch entsprechend umsetzen. Solltest du mit diesen Bedingungen nicht einverstanden sein, so möchten wir dir nahe legen dir eine andere Instanz zu suchen.

Was ist Mastodon?

Mastodon ist ein offenes soziales Netzwerk. Es basiert auf offenen Web-Protokollen und freier, quelloffener Software. Es ist dezentral (so wie E-Mail!).

Infos zu Mastodon findest du auf beispielsweise unter folgenden Links:
  • Mastodon – das bessere Twitter? (mobilsicher.de)
  • Mastodon – das Social Media Netzwerk erklärt (rosenblut.org)

Falls du von Twitter kommst oder überlegst zu wechseln können wir dir diesen Beitrag von contentnation.net ans Herz legen.

Tipps und Tricks gibt es u.a. hier:
  • Was Du (als Twitterer) über Mastodon wissen solltest (contentnation.net)
  • Ausbruch aus dem Vogelkäfig – Ein Mastodon-Guide (schwarzerpfeil.de)
  • Eine kleine Mastodon Anleitung (hopidd.de)

Nutzungsbedingungen

Für das Erstellen und den Betrieb eines Kontos auf diesem Mastodon-Server ist die Zustimmung zu den nachfolgenden Nutzungsbedingungen erforderlich. Die Moderation setzt diese Regeln aktiv durch. Nichtbeachtung kann verschiedene Maßnahmen wie einfache Ermahnungen, Löschung von Beiträgen, zeitweise/dauerhafte Sperrungen bis hin zur Löschung eines Kontos zur Folge haben.
Einige dieser Maßnahmen können auch bei Nutzer:innen anderer Instanzen erfolgen. Auch die Sperrung aller Inhalte anderer Instanzen ist möglich.

Accounts

Diese Instanz ist für den persönlichen Austausch natürlicher Nutzer:innen und der Präsentation von Vereinigungen oder Organisationen mit Sitz in Hessen gedacht. Voll-automatisierte Accounts sind nicht gestattet. Das schließt insbesondere Accounts ein, auf denen mit Automationswerkzeugen geposted, aber nie anders interagiert wird (Antworten, Boosten, etc.). Ausnahmen von dieser Regelung siehe „Bots“.
Aktive Nutzer:innen dürfen ergänzend Werkzeuge für automatisches Posten verwenden. (z.B. Crossposter).

Mindestalter

Unser Angebot erfordert eine Zustimmung zu den Datenschutzrichtlinien. Gemäß DSGVO ist dies nur Personen möglich die das 16. Lebensjahr vollendet haben. Wenn du unter 16 Jahren bist, darfst du diese Plattform daher leider nicht benutzen.

Allgemeine Verhaltensregeln

  • Sei immer freundlich und höflich. Behandle andere mit Respekt.
  • Belästige und beleidige niemanden und unterlasse persönliche Angriffe.Weder allein noch als Gruppe. Das Veröffentlichen oder die Androhung von Veröffentlichung von personen-identifizierenden Informationen ("doxing") wird als Belästigung ausgelegt.
  • Kontaktiere keine Nutzer:innen die angegeben haben, dass sie nicht kontaktiert werden möchten.
  • Die Nutzung oder Befürwortung von rassistischer, sexistischer, homophober, transphober, behindertenfeindlicher und anderweitig diskriminierender oder hasserfüllter Sprache bzw. verharmlosende oder gutheißende Inhalte zu Weißer Vorherrschaft, Antisemitismus, Transphobie oder anderen hasserfüllten Ideologien wird nicht geduldet.
  • Nochmal ganz deutlich: Wir dulden keine nationalistische Propaganda, keine Nazi-Symbolik und keine Förderung der Ideologie des Nationalsozialismus!
  • Nachgewiesene Falschinformationen/Fakenews sind hier unerwünscht.
  • Poste keine pornographischen oder sexualisierten Inhalte. Dazu gehören auch Witze und Kommentare.
  • Halte dich an die in Deutschland geltenden Gesetze (verbietet u.a. auch gewaltverherrlichende Inhalte).
  • Veröffentliche keinen Spam oder kommerzielle Werbung. Kommerzielle Werbung in diesem Zusammenhang bedeutet, wenn die veröffentlichten Inhalte keinen persönlichen Bezug aufweisen und eindeutig dazu gedacht sind, direkt oder indirekt Geld zu erwirtschaften.

Öffentliche Toots

Bei öffentliche Toots müssen zusätzlich die folgende Punkte beachtet werden:

  • Nutze Inhaltswarnungen
    Veröffentliche keine Inhalte über kontroverse, aufrührerische oder triggernde Themen ohne eine Inhaltswarnung zu verwenden.
  • Keine Killerphrasen, schwarze Rhetorik oder Sophismus
    Dies gebietet bereits ein respektvoller Umgang. Dennoch möchten wir nochmals betonen, dass unsachliche Diskussionsbeiträge die der vorsätzlichen Schädigung der Diskussion zur Folge haben unerwünscht sind. Dazu zählen bspw. auch Scheinargument-Attacken (auch ad hominem genannt) oder die Kritik an inklusiver Sprache, wenn diese nicht das Thema der Diskussion ist.
  • Kritik an Moderationsentscheidungen
    Diskutiere Moderationsentscheidungen nicht zuerst in öffentlichen Toots. Wenn Du nicht einverstanden bist wie ein Moderation diese Bedingungen interpretiert und anwendet, dann kontaktiere uns. Schicke eine Mail an kontakt@hessen.social oder schreibe eine Direktnachricht an @moomendemol@hessen.social

Bugs

Gefundene Fehler in der Software auf hessen.social sind umgehend zu melden.

Melden & Moderation

Wenn dir hier ein Toot auffällt, der diesen Kodex verletzt, melde das bitte immer. Es ist gut möglich, dass jemand anderes diesen Inhalt bereits gemeldet hat. Allerdings passiert es schnell, dass alle so denken und es am Ende niemand meldet.

Bots

Spezielle Bot-Accounts sind erlaubt, soweit sie die nachfolgenden Bedingungen erfüllen.

  • Es gelten die gleichen Regelungen wie für alle anderen Accounts.
  • Es muss eine erreichbare Kontaktperson in der Beschreibung des Bots in einem Tabellenfeld 'Kontaktperson' zu finden sein.
  • Die Profilbeschreibung muss einen kurzen Text über den Sinn und Zweck des Bots enthalten.
  • Bots dürfen lediglich Nicht gelistet posten, um mehr Raum für relevantere, lokale Inhalte zu bieten.
  • Ausnahmen von diesen Regelungen sind nach Absprache möglich.

Unzulässige/gesperrte Maildomains

Aufgrund von zunehmenden Spamaccounts wurde die Nutzung von Wegwerfmailadressen und häufigen Spammerdomains unterbunden (siehe auch nächsten Abschnitt zu gmail.com).
Die gesperrten Domains finden sich hier: https://github.com/disposable-email-domains/disposable-email-domains

Sollte sich in dieser Liste eine Domain befinden die ihr selber nutzt und dort als falsch erachtet, könnt ihr
1. unter dem o.g. Link ein Issue eröffnen um die Domain von der Sperrliste zu nehmen
2. falls 1. nicht klappt oder nicht möglich ist, uns eine Mail schreiben um eine lokale Ausnahme zu erstellen.

GMail-Nutzer:innen

Nach zwei Wochen Betrieb zeigt sich bereits, dass von Maildomains mit der Endung "@gmail.com" eine enorme Menge Spamaccounts angelegt werden. Daher ist die Domain ab sofort gesperrt. Wenn du eine Google-Adresse nutzen willst, dann ersetze @gmail.com einfach durch @googlemail.com, das funktioniert auch. Alternativ kannst du natürlich auch eine andere Mailadresse nehmen, am besten von einem Mailprovider der deine Mailinhalte nicht durchforstet und zu Werbezwecken nutzt.

Automatische Löschung von Accounts

Wir behalten uns vor, Nutzeraccounts, die keine Aktivität zeigen, zu löschen. Die Aktivität wird unter anderem am letzten Login und der Tootaktivität festgemacht. So fallen bspw. Accounts die 3 Monate ohne Login sind und noch nie etwas getootet haben unter diese Regelung.

Rechtliches

Bei der Nutzung des Angebots findet deutsches Recht Anwendung. Gerichtsstand ist Darmstadt. Die Nutzung erfolgt ausschließlich freiwillig. Die Nutzung des Dienstes kann von den Betreiber:innen ohne Angabe von Gründen untersagt werden. Es gelten die separaten Datenschutzbestimmungen.

Weiterführende Informationen über diesen Server

Mastodon Server Covenant

Dieser Server verfolgt die Mastodon Server Covenant

  1. Aktive Moderation gegen Rassismus, Homophobie und Transphobie
    Siehe Nutzungsbedingungen und Regeln
  2. Tägliche Backups
    Wir erstellen tägliche automatische und verschlüsselte externe Backups
  3. Mindestens eine weitere Person mit (Notfall)Zugang zur Serverinfrastruktur
    Siehe Backup-Admin
  4. Zusicherung, dass User mindestens drei Monate im Voraus benachrichtigt werden, falls der Dienst eingestellt werden sollte
    Wir behalten uns das Recht vor diesen Dienst jederzeit einzustellen. Nach Bekanntgabe versichern wir aber eine Übergangszeit von mindestens 3 Monaten um etwaige Daten zu sichern und einen Account-Umzug durchzuführen zu können.

Impressum

Anbieter des Dienstes:

Stephan Voeth
Kahlertstraße 5a
64293 Darmstadt
Mastodon: @moomendemol@hessen.social oder @stvo@darmstadt.social
Matrix: @stvo:tchncs.de
E-Mail: stvo@hessen.social

Backup-Admin

eichkat3r
Mastodon: @eichkat3r@hessen.social

Datenschutz

Sicherheit, Integrität und Datenschutz sind Maxime die wir bei hessen.social umgesetzt haben. Unser Ziel ist es daher nicht nur den rechtlichen Vorgaben wie der Datenschutz-Grundverordnung (kurz "DSGVO") zu genügen, sondern bei der notwendigen Verarbeitung von personenbezogenen Daten die maximal technisch mögliche Datensparsamkeit zu erreichen. Ganz ohne Datenverarbeitung geht es aber nicht. Welche Daten wir verarbeiten und ewarum findest du in unserer Datenschutzerklärung

Spenden

Der Betrieb von hessen.social und das zugehörige Monitoring und Backup kostet uns Geld. Die Nutzung von hessen.social wird immer kosten- und werbefrei bleiben. Anstatt uns aber Geld für den Betrieb dieses Servers zu zahlen, gebt doch lieber Geld an das Computerwerk. Dafür gibt es auch eine Spendenquittung :)

Danksagung

Vielen Dank an die Fediverse-Community und insbesondere @w4tsn von darmstadt.social, der uns beim Einstieg unterstützt hat :)

Stranger.social is a general use server and open to the public. This server is US based server. Cloud hosted and backed-up daily.

Community Support - Our Mastodon server is run by a team of volunteers and is supported by the community. We rely on the generosity of our users to help cover the costs of running the server, such as hosting fees, domain registration, and other expenses.

If you would like to help support our server, there are several ways you can contribute:

  • Donate to our server's Patreon
    • Visit us on Patreon
  • Keep your Strange Social Team caffeinated.
    • Buy us a coffee
  • Share our server with your friends and encourage them to join
  • Your support is greatly appreciated and helps to ensure that our server can continue to operate and thrive. Thank you for being a part of our community!

Code of Conduct - Welcome to our Mastodon server! We are a community of Strangers looking for safe harbor in our Social Media lives. To ensure that everyone has a positive and enjoyable experience on our server, we have established the following rules of conduct.

  • Be respectful and considerate of others. This means no hate speech, harassment, or discrimination of any kind.
  • Keep the conversation appropriate for all ages, within reason. This means no explicit or graphic content that is not suitable for a general audience.
  • Do not spam or engage in malicious activity. This includes bot spam, phishing attempts, and other harmful behavior.
  • Follow the law. This includes not sharing illegal or copyrighted material.
  • Use common sense and good judgment. If you're not sure if something is appropriate, ask a moderator or administrator. We're not here to be tyrants, we just want everyone to have a good time.
  • We reserve the right to remove any content or accounts that violate these rules, or that we deem harmful to the community. We also reserve the right to modify these rules as necessary. If you have any questions or concerns, please contact a moderator or administrator.

Thank you for being a part of our community!

Status Page Please visit our Status Page for real-time status of the server.

Bot Developers - Welcome bot developers! We invite you to join our Mastodon server and enhance the user experience. Please check in with our server admin @azcoigreach before deploying any bots and be ethical and constructive in your development.

Reporting and Moderation - When reporting accounts, please include at least a few postings that demonstrate rule-breaking behavior, if appropriate. Please provide any relevant supporting information in the comment if it could be used to inform a decision. This is especially crucial when the content is in a language other than English.

We typically respond to reports within 24 hours. Please keep in mind that you are not contacted when a complaint you filed results in a punitive action, and that not all punitive acts are apparent from the outside. We may choose to erase offensive content for first-time offenses before progressing to harsher sanctions for repeat violations.
