info.full_description:
The Rules

By joining laserdisc.party, you agree to abide by our Code of Conduct. Spoiler alert: it's basically the same as the one over at toot.cafe, including their instance banlist (shout out to Nolan), supplimented by Dzuk's exhaustively-compiled banlist (shout out to Dzuk). We have a few little LP-specific additions, but overall, the short of it is this; don't be an asshole, use content warnings liberally (this includes spoilers, gore, sex, nudity, etc, but also workaday stuff like politics, mental health, and multi-toot posts), and for the love of God, be kind. If you can't do that, we'll have no choice but to bust out the banhammer. And if you think asking you to put sensitive content behind a CW is encroaching on your free speech, well, tough shit. Also, and I say this emphatically, if you're a Nazi, a bigot, a TERF, a SWERF, a crypto huckster or otherwise a hate-peddler? Take a hike. We don't need or want you here.

We also invite users of l.p to consider the user experience of everyone else here. It's not just a matter of etiquette, really. It's a matter of being just a decent person. It costs nuthin' to make stuff easier and more pleasant for others, so yes, CW liberally, add descriptions to images, camel-case hashtags with more than one word in 'em.

We want laserdisc.party to be a place for movie people, writers included. But if your account is all news aggregation and links to your website, I'm afraid you'll have to pitch your tent somewhere else. Plugging your stuff is cool, but it can't be all you do.

Again, laserdisc.party is a place for movie people. You can toot about anything (within the rules, natch), but we'd like this place to be a "movie-flavoured general instance," if you will.

If you have any questions problems (harassment troubles, clarifications, movie recs) get a hold of Derek. He'll help you out.

Any rebroadcast, reproduction, or other use of the toots and media on this instance without the express written consent of the laserdisc.party user in question is prohibited.

Mascot art by u/Nocut12

More Specific Rules, via mastodon.social

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of laserdisc.party; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

  1. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:
    • Excessive advertising
    • Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
    • Untagged nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions
    • Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions
  2. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
    • Racism or advocation of racism
    • Sexism or advocation of sexism
    • Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
    • Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism
  3. The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
    • Sexual depictions of children
    • Content illegal in Germany and/or France, such as holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism
    • Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism
  4. Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:
    • Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
    • Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
    • Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.

Willkommen bei subversive.zone!

Selbstverständnis

Subversive.Zone hat das Ziel, eine überwiegend deutschsprachige Mastodoninstanz für Menschen mit emanzipatorischem Anspruch zu sein. Wir möchten nicht „die eine Instanz“ sein, sondern sehen uns als Teil eines losen Netzwerks mit anderen emanzipatorischen und antiautoritäten Instanzen.

Emanzipatorische Werte wollen wir bereits jetzt aktiv leben, anstatt darauf zu warten, dass sie sich mit „der Revolution oder dem Ende des Kapitalismus“ schon von selbst einstellen und sie bis dahin unterzuordnen.

Wir legen einen Fokus auf Zugänglichkeit und nutzen die Werkzeuge, die Mastodon hierfür bereitstellt, wie Bildbeschreibungen und Inhaltswarnungen.

Weiterhin dulden wir keine Transfeindlichkeit und Sexarbeiter:innenfeindlichkeit sowie kein Eintreten für Autoritarismus, Nationalismus oder Antisemitismus.

Regeln

Wir möchten eine Community im Sinne unseres Selbstverständnisses sein. Explizit bedeutet das, dass folgendes auf dieser Instanz nicht toleriert wird:

  • Belästigung und Stalking
  • Rassismus, Sexismus, Nationalismus, Ableismus, Transfeindlichkeit
  • Explizit Tankies (ML/M), Querfrontler:innen, TERFs, SWERFs
  • Menschen kontaktieren, die ausdrücklich keinen Kontakt wünschen
  • Bots, die ohne ihre expliziten Anfragen mit Nutzer*Innen interagieren
  • Nationalflaggen in Profilbeschreibungen
  • In Deutschland strafrechtlich relevante Inhalte

Um die Instanz für möglichst viele Menschen zugänglich zu halten, verwendet bitte, sofern es euch möglich ist, Bildbeschreibungen und Inhaltswarnungen, beispielsweise für sexuelle Inhalte oder Darstellung von Gewalt.

Bitte meldet Verhalten, das stört. Das kann auch andere Instanzen betreffen, die wir ggf. stummschalten oder blockieren können.

info.full_description:
[in English] - [Impressum]

Willkommen!

BluePlanet.social ist eine Instanz für alle, die sich primär als Erdenbürger*in auf unserem blauen Planeten verstehen und an einem respektvollen Miteinander aller Menschen interessiert sind.
BluePlanet.social soll ein sicherer und angenehmer Platz für alle sein, dies schließt ausdrücklich Menschen aus marginalisierten Gruppen ein.

Auf dieser Instanz sind alle User*innen willkommen, die sich mit den Zielen und Regeln der Instanz identifizieren und einverstanden erklären. Ebenso bieten wir ein Zuhause für gemeinnützige Organisationen und gemeinnützige Unternehmen. Accounts von nachhaltig wirtschaftenden kleinen Unternehmen mit Gewinnerzielungsabsicht sind nach vorheriger Rücksprache ebenfalls zulässig.

Nutzungsbedingungen & Datenschutz

Als Nutzer*in dieser Instanz erklärst du dich mit den unten stehenden Server-Regeln sowie den Nutzungsbedingungen, Haftungsausschlüssel und Datenschutzbestimmungen einverstanden. Dort befinden sich auch die Regelungen zur Nutzung durch Organisationen und Unternehmen.

    Es gilt prinzipiell die Grundregel: Seid anständig. Etwas genauer:
  • Keine Diskriminierung (jeglicher Art) oder Befürwortung von Diskriminierung. Belästigungen, Mobbing, Bedrohungen, Stalking oder Doxxing werden nicht toleriert.
  • Bots, Spam oder die Nachahmung von existierenden Accounts sind nicht zulässig.
  • Verschwörungsnarrative, Fake-News, pseudowissenschaftliche oder wissenschaftsleugnende Beiträge sind unerwünscht.
  • Nationalistische, faschistische, antisemitische oder antidemokratische Inhalte haben hier keinen Platz.
  • Inhalte, die gegen die Gesetze der Bundesrepublik Deutschland verstoßen, werden gelöscht und ggf. zur Anzeige gebracht.

Technik & CO₂-Fußabdruck

Dieser Server befindet sich in Nordfriesland (Deutschland) und wird zu 100 % mit physikalisch grünem Strom (größtenteils aus Windenergie) betrieben. Die Abwärme des Rechenzentrums wird u. A. zum Betrieb einer Algenfarm genutzt. Alle Daten werden täglich verschlüsselt in einem unabhängigen (mit Strom aus Wasserkraft betriebenen) Datencenter in Süddeutschland gesichert und dort für 7 Tage aufbewahrt. Details über die Betreiber finden sich hier.
Als Betriebssystem kommt Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (Jammy Jellyfish) mit aktiviertem Kernel Livepatching zum Einsatz. Weitere sicherheitsrelevante Updates werden i.d.R. innerhalb von 24 Stunden eingespielt. Die Serververwaltung erfolgt über die Software Cloudron. Der Betriebsstatus der Dienste wird mittels der Open-Source-Software Uptime Kuma permanent aus einem unabhängigen Rechenzentrum überwacht, der aktuelle Status lässt sich jederzeit über https://status.blueplanet.social/ abrufen. Auch dieses Rechenzentrum wird zu 100 % mit erneuerbarer Energie betrieben.

Registrierungs-E-Mail nicht bekommen? In der Regel liegt dies an deinem Mail-Anbieter. Bitte melde dich per direkter E-Mail an admin@blueplanet.social - ich schaue mir an, ob sich das Problem beheben lässt. Generell empfehle ich den Wechsel zu seriösen Mail-Anbietern, die alle gängigen Sicherheitsstandards erfüllen und gleichzeitig die Privatsphäre der Nutzer*innen schützen. Als Beispiele seien hier tuta.com (ab 0€), proton.me (ab 0€), mailbox.org (ab 1€) und posteo.de (ab 1€) genannt.

Kosten

Die Nutzung dieser Instanz ist kostenlos. Wer es sich wirtschaftlich leisten kann und möchte, ist herzlich eingeladen, sich an den nicht unerheblichen Serverkosten zu beteiligen. Dies hilft, auch künftig die Nutzung durch Menschen zu ermöglichen, die hierfür keine finanziellen Mittel aufbringen können.
Eine transparente Aufstellung aller Kosten und Einnahmen befindet sich auf Open Collective.

CW & Netiquette

Als Ausdruck der gegenseitigen Wertschätzung bitten wir Bildbeschreibungen zu verwenden und von CW (Content Warning) Gebrauch zu machen bzw. Medien mit NSFW-Tag zu versehen, wenn es um Themen wie Tod, Suizid, Waffen, Hass, psychischer und physischer Gewalt (inkl. Kriegsdarstellungen), Übergriffe, Misshandlungen, Sex, Drogen, Trigger geläufiger Phobien oder Medien-Spoiler (Liste nicht abschließend) geht. Ein CW bei politischen Themen ist auf BluePlanet.social nicht als Regelfall vorgesehen.

Bitte ladet aus Kostengründen keine Videos direkt auf BluePlanet.social hoch, sondern verwendet hierfür eine Video-Plattform (z.B. PeerTube) und verlinkt dorthin
Für Fortgeschrittene: Bitte automatisiert erstellte Nachrichten (bspw. von Crosspostern) unbedingt auf "ungelistet" stellen. Es wäre außerdem nett, wenn ihr bei Threads die der ersten Nachricht folgenden Antworten ebenfalls auf "ungelistet" setzt.

Föderation & Blocklist

Prinzipiell sind über diese Instanz alle anderen Instanzen im Fediverse erreichbar.
BluePlanet.social ist aktuell an 10 deutsche und internationale ActivityPub Relays angebunden.

Wir blockieren Instanzen vollständig, die fortwährend gegen die Grundsätze von BluePlanet verstoßen, beispielsweise indem sie diskriminierende oder illegale Inhalte befördern oder nicht moderieren. Hierzu zählen auch BirdsiteLIVE-Instanzen. Die Blocklist kann am Ende dieser Seite eingesehen werden, registrierte Benutzer*innen sehen zusätzlich den Grund für die Sperre.

Der Betrieb und die Moderation dieser Instanz erfolgen auf Grundlage des Mastodon Serverabkommens und des strikteren Fedimins Serverabkommens.
Bitte meldet sowohl User*innen als auch Instanzen, die gegen die Grundsätze von BluePlanet.social verstoßen. Ebenso bitte ich um Hinweis, falls sich eurer Meinung nach eine Instanz zu Unrecht auf der Blocklist befindet. Vielen Dank für die Mithilfe!

Transparenzhinweis: Auf der Seite der trendenden Newsbeiträge werden, sofern als solche erkenntlich, nicht vertrauenswürdige Nachrichtenseiten ausgefiltert. Hierbei greife ich u. a. auf die Bewertungen von NewsGuard zurück. Rechte Medien oder Medien der Axel Springer SE werden generell nicht freigeschaltet. Es handelt sich insofern nicht um eine neutrale Nachrichtensammlung. Bitte verwendet andere Web-Seiten, um einen Überblick über das gesamte politische Spektrum zu erhalten.

International Users

Welcome to BluePlanet.social. We are a mainly German-speaking Mastodon instance, but English speaking users are very welcome to join.
BluePlanet.social is an instance for all who see themselves primarily as citizens of the earth on our blue planet and are interested in a respectful coexistence of all people.
BluePlanet.social is meant to be a safe and comfortable place for everyone, this explicitly includes people from marginalized groups.

On this instance, all users are welcome who identify and agree with the goals and rules of the instance. We also offer a home for non-profit organizations and non-profit companies. Accounts of sustainably operating small and medium-sized for-profit companies are also permitted after prior contact.

We can not ensure moderation in other languages. So if you intend to frequently post in a language other than German or English, kindly check out Fedi.Garden or instances.social to find an instance that suits you better.

This instance adheres to the Mastodon Server Covenant.
Please file a report if you spot any misconduct on this instance or if you believe an account or an instance has been blocked in error.

Welcome

Gladtech.social was started in October 2022 to create a place for people to go after the beloved technology-focused Mastodon instance, mastodon.technology, shut down. After using mastodon.technology myself for so long (and having a great time!), I felt like I should try to give something back to the Fediverse. So here it is, a new instance. I hope many kind and thoughtful people on the internet will find a new home here.

- Jeff

Audience

This instance is aimed at the general technology crowd. Topics often discussed here often include software, hardware, firmware, shareware... Anything ending in -ware, really. Feel free to talk about $DAY_JOB, weekend hobbies, and anything in between.

If you're looking for more focus than all of technology (I know, right?), then feel free to pay attention to online privacy and open source software in particular. That's where the instance name comes from. AdTech and the larger ecosystem of surveillance capitalism and the attention economy are a pox on all our houses. GladTech represents a kind of response to that pox. An antibody, if you will. Don't contribute to AdTech. Instead, contribute to software that makes people glad. Contribute to GladTech.

Don't feel like you need to limit discussions to tech topics only though. Everyone needs a break from that now and then. Really, anyone who is willing to abide by the rules of conduct is welcome here, and their conversations are welcome too. If you're looking for non-tech ideas, pictures of cats are almost always welcome! #caturday

Customizations

Gladtech.social uses a customized version of Mastodon!

For now, I've only made a few minor tweaks:

  • Toots can be up to 2048 characters in length. Because powers of two are awesome!
  • The "Publish" button has been renamed back to "Toot", because we all deserve a little whimsy in our lives.

But in the future, I might get a little more ambitious. I'm thinking about adding encryption to the DMs someday. But I'm not quite ready for that yet.

Anyway, all the customizations for this instance can be found on the Codeberg account:
https://codeberg.org/cuchazinteractive/Mastodon

Sustainability

AKA: Will this instance still be around X years from now?

Predicting the future is hard, but here's some more information. Maybe that will help.

Renting cloud resources to run the instance costs money, and Mastodon uses a lot of resources apparently. The last time this section was updated (Dec 2022), the server had about 30 active users and a monthly cost of about 27/mo USD. The instance is running on a small self-managed virtual private server (VPS) at the moment. It's about the least expensive way I can think to do it. At this level of cost, I'm happy to keep funding maintenance costs out-of-pocket. It costs about as much as a couple TV channel subscriptions. Consider it my donation to the fediverse.

Someday though, if enough members hang out here, I might not be able to keep paying the bill personally. I don't yet know how big of a bill it will take to tap me out or how long it will take for the instance to grow that big, if ever. If that ever happens though, I'll open up the instance for donations from members. I've seen that model work well in other places, so we can consider that here if the time comes.

Rules of Conduct

  • No advertising or excessive promotion.
  • No bots, unless they're cute, funny, or useful. Bots should avoid posting to the public timeline.
  • No pornography.
  • No gore or graphic violence.
  • Content that is borderline NSFW or could be construed as NSFW at a glance should be put behind a CW (Content Warning).
  • No racism.
  • No sexism.
  • No discrimination based on gender, sexual minority, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, religion (or lack thereof), or national origin.
  • No xenophobia, nationalism, casteism, or fascism; no sympathizing with or advocating for these things.
  • No sexual depictions of children.
  • No holocaust denialism, no Nazi symbolism, no promotion of National Socialism.
  • No stalking or harassment. In general, if someone asks you to stop interacting with them, then stop.
  • Stalking, harassment, hate speech, or doxing that is posted to other instances or on other social media platforms is still grounds for having your account terminated here.
  • No posting (or threatening to post) other people's personally identifying information ("doxing").
  • No unwelcome sexual attention.
  • No public or private oppressive language or actions.
  • No promotion of conspiracy theories (eg anti-vax, anti-mask, anti-COVID).
  • No unsolicited advice to strangers.
  • No advocating for, or encouraging, any of the above behaviour.
  • No other unethical conduct.
  • No scraping content from web interface or API.

To protect the free speech of users belonging to marginalized groups, this instance does not federate with overtly fascist instances. Additionally, we will refuse to federate with instances that themselves choose to federate with fascist instances.

Our rules of conduct and instance block lists were forked from mastodon.technology, so a huge thanks to Ash and the moderation team there for sharing their great work with everyone!

Handling harassment

If you are being harassed, please report the user using the "…" button and then "Report."

If you engage in harassing behavior, the moderator may take any action they deem appropriate, such as a warning or an expulsion.

The above rules may change at any time, and you may be banned at any time based on the moderators' judgment.

Privacy policy

What will we do with your data? Nothing. How will you be influenced by advertisers? You won't. How will we aggregate your data in order to improve your service… none of that.

We will never share your data with anyone else, except in the case of valid legal requests, if it comes to that. (Hopefully it won't come to that!) Similarly, users and third parties are forbidden from scraping content from the instance's web interface or API; you are required to respect robots.txt files.

More privacy information about this instance:

  • HTTPS is used everywhere thanks to Let's Encrypt.
  • No ads or trackers.
  • Links are direct URLs rather than tracking redirects.
  • Understand though that this instance is run by a human administrator (Jeff), and (as is the case with all Mastodon servers) that administrator potentially has access to your data, including DMs. The back-end is also not encrypted. If this is not okay with you, this might not be the instance for you.

Also understand that Mastodon has no real privacy guarantees. Specifically, Mastodon does not offer end-to-end encryption (E2EE). Mastodon is only really designed for communication in "the public square". If, instead, you want to have private conversations, consider using an app with stronger privacy guarantees, like Signal.

I advise you read this if you're posting on here or the fediverse in general. It's a fun place, but be aware what you're getting into. I do my best to defederate from harmful instances, but I'm just a guy. https://blog.bloonface.com/2023/07/04/the-fediverse-is-a-privacy-nightmare/

Wecome to Australia’s Neurodiverse Community Instance.

This instance is not just for those that are neurodivergent but for any Australian that believes that all people should be treated equally. It can be used for whatever the community feels necessary, as long as the instance’s rules permit it.

**Each person using this instance is required to be able to manage their own triggers, as this is connected to the Fediverse, and other instances do not have to follow our instance’s rules.

This instance currently does not require donations as it’s running costs are being covered by the Admin (@stephen).

You are in safe hands

This server abides by the Mastodon Server Covenant

  1. Active moderation against racism, sexism, homophobia and transphobia Users must be confident that they are joining a safe space, free from white supremacy, antisemitism and transphobia of other platforms.

  2. Daily backups Users must be confident that a trip over the power cable or a rogue bit flip will not erase all of their data. Having a backup strategy is a basic necessity of providing a public service.

  3. At least one other person with emergency access to the server infrastructure Various circumstances can prevent the original owner of the Mastodon server from answering technical emergencies. For this reason, more than one person must have that capability.

  4. Commitment to give users at least three months of advance warning in case of shutting down Sometimes services shut down, and it is the cycle of life. But users must be confident that their account will not disappear overnight, so they have time to export their data and find another server.

Instance Rules

This instance intends to allow the neurodiverse community a safe, inclusive and judgement-free environment to unmask. To allow this to occur, some rules must be followed.

Be Friendly

  • The internet was designed to connect computers and the people that use them. Its role is no longer to launch nuclear weapons, but the computers and people idea is still there
  • Remember that the other computers you are communicating with are other humans. Their life may be less, the same, or more complex than you know. Treat them how you would like to be treated
  • Consider the reach of the posts you make. Tag content that you expect others might not want to see.
  • Harassment and bullying of any kind are not tolerated here. Do not engage with a user if they do not want you to. Do not ask other users to, either. If you feel a post generated on this server violates this rule, bring it to a moderator's attention.

No Baiting

  • Do not make posts to get angry reactions.
  • “I was being ironic” is a highly flimsy excuse for misbehaving.
  • Avoid sarcasm as it does not translate well in a web form, and even less for the neurodiverse who may not understand sarcasm
  • Do not drag unrelated people into a discussion

Follow the Law

  • This server is located in New South Wales, Australia. It and its users must obey all state and commonwealth laws
  • Do not share or distribute copyright material, pornography of any kind, personally protected information, and everything else illegal.

No Spam

  • Bots that interact with a user without a user's explicit permission are not permitted
  • Automated posting is not permitted without explicit admin permission.

No Commercial Accounts

  • Access to Neurodiversity-in.au is provided without requirement of payment to all individuals.
  • Commercial accounts are restricted to those that provide a service to the community and have been approved by administrators.
  • Any commercial accounts must have been pre-approved by the administrators, or they will be suspended without notice.

Be aware of the nature of the network.

  • This website is part of a network of similar websites. Other websites may have different rules.
  • The local administration has little control over users of other websites. You can, however, block and mute them - the same as local users.
  • In egregious cases, remote users or entire groups of users may be blocked from interacting with users of this website.

Admin decisions are final.

  • The interpretation of these rules is up to the administration, and an admins decision overrides the rules.
  • “Technically, I did not violate any rule” is a flimsy excuse for misbehaving.
  • The rules may be changed or amended when necessary without notice

These rules aim to ensure a safe and welcoming environment.

  • This goal guides rule enforcement.
  • Any enforcement action will generally be kept between those involved.
  • Try to self-moderate, but do not hesitate to involve an admin when necessary. There are presently two people with administrative access to the website, @stephen and @emichan. You can report rule violations via the report function or e-mail.

Code of Ethics

This site has adopted the UFoL Code of Ethics, which are as follows:

  • No hate speech, defined as any communication in speech, writing or behaviour that attacks or uses pejorative or discriminatory language concerning a protected characteristic, in other words, based on their age, disability, ethnicity, gender, pregnancy, religion, nationality, sex or sexuality.
  • No Calls to violence. Any individual is promoting violence towards any person or group.
  • No intentionally circumventing blocks, for example, by creating new accounts, even on a separate instance, with the intent of circumventing a ban/block.
  • No harassment. If a user explicitly asks you to disengage and you do not, explicit calls to dogpile will not be acceptable.
  • All bots must respect the #nobot tag and must post unlisted.
  • Posts intended for commercial advertisement must be posted with the #ad tag or unlisted. Nudity involving genitals, sexual acts, or pornography must be posted either unlisted, with a content warning, or both.

info.full_description:
Come be a Cheeseburger

(hamburgers and veggie burgers welcome as well) or just be yourself.

This server is open for anyone to sign up and have fun.

Server Features:

  • Running on the Mastodon-glitch fork

  • As Well As Mastodon v4.1.0

Post Character limit is increased to 1000 characters per post from the default 500!

Server Technical Info.

This server is self hosted by the admin(@bacon)

Current Server Specs:

  • 2 Ubuntu OS Virtual Machines hosted on a Proxmox Server

  • 4cpu's with 6GB RAM Per VM

  • 1gb fiber connection

  • Ability to scale up server with more resources as needed.

  • Daily Backups and Retention of multiple backup versions.

  • Server is on a battery backup

Extended Rules ¶

"Be excellent to each other" is easier said than done, and means different things to different people.

The following rules are a (non-exhaustive) list of behaviours that may lead to deletion of toots, silencing or suspension of accounts, at the descretion of the instance administrators, as described in our Terms.

Please report behaviour that bothers you. We will keep your report confidential.

  • We do not tolerate discriminatory behaviour and content promoting or advocating the oppression of members of marginalised groups. These groups may be characterised by any of the following (though this list is naturally incomplete):
    • ethnicity
    • gender identity or expression
    • sexual identity or expression
    • physical characteristics or age
    • disability or illness
    • nationality, residency, citizen status
    • wealth or education
    • religious affiliation, agnosticism or atheism
  • We do not tolerate threatening behaviour, stalking, and doxxing.
  • We do not tolerate harassment, including brigading, dogpiling, or any other form of contact with a user who has stated that they do not wish to be contacted.
  • We do not tolerate mobbing, including name-calling, intentional misgendering or deadnaming.
  • We do not tolerate violent nationalist propaganda, Nazi symbolism or promoting the ideology of National Socialism.
  • Actions intended to damage this instance or its performance may lead to immediate account suspension.
  • Content that is illegal in Germany will be deleted and may lead to immediate account suspension.

Best practices ¶

The list below is a collection of behaviour that we expect to see from our users. If you see a user go against these best practices in a way that bothers you, please file a report and we will talk to them. While these best practices are designed to be guidelines for a good communal instance, repeated malicious unwillingness to follow the best practices will be considered just like breaking a rule.

  • In general, use the tools provided to foster a considerate and accessible atmosphere. This includes the liberal use of content warnings (especially on potentially disturbing or controversial topics), and alt-text captioning of media files.
  • When possible, provide credit for creative works in your posts that are not your own.
  • Uninvited comments about another user's personal choices, lifestyle or family are strongly discouraged and may be considered harassment. Inappropriate sexual attention, comments about appearance and implication of physical contact will not be tolerated toward any non-consenting user.
  • If you post sexual content or gore, use content warnings.
  • If you post advertisements, use a content warning. Advertisements should not be excessive or automated.
  • Bots may only interact with a user when they're invited by that user to do so.
  • Automated posts and high-frequency posts should be unlisted (rendering visible to everybody, but not appearing on the local timeline) to keep the local timeline of our instance a place of community dialogue and human interaction. This extends to bots, feed posters, Twitter "retweets" and Twitter crossposts with broken mentions. Crossposter accounts that stop being active participants in our community may be removed at the discretion of the moderators.
  • In discussions, please remain civil, do not insult the people you're talking to. Note that irony, sarcasm, or similar modes of language don't translate well to written language and tend to escalate discussions or misunderstandings.
(These best practices were inspired by the Terms of bsd.network. Thank you!)

Resources ¶

You can find further information on our instance on our dedicated page, which includes a list of currently blocked or silenced instances.

We are maintaining this instance on our spare time, hardware and nerves. Don't push either of those.

Welcome to Pawsitiv Space's Social Space

Pawsitiv Space is founded on the principles of respect, inclusion, and positivity. These principles and the goals and standards of the community extend to this Social Space as well.

Posts can have up to 500 characters, be formatted with Markdown, Content Warnings, and up to 4 attachments with custom focal points for thumbnails, custom video thumbnails, and descriptions/alt-text for others. You can also edit or delete and re-draft your posts after publishing.

We aren't trying to sell you anything here, nor are we trying to sell you. Enjoy the content you want when you want it. You choose what you see!

You can learn more about using our Mastodon instance here.

Social Space Guidelines

In addition to following the Pawsitiv Space Code of Conduct, there are additional guidelines for our Social Space.

Restricted Content

We allow any content defined in the Code of Conduct Restricted Content section under the following guidelines:

  • Text is hidden behind a Content Warning
  • Media is marked as sensitive with a description or Content Warning
  • The Content Warning or description used has:
    • An appropriate description of the hidden content so users can decide if they want to interact
    • Appropriate hashtags so users can automatically filter content they don't wish to see

Crossposting

"Crossposting" is the automatic copying of posts between platforms. This does not include posts made simultaneously from the same app to multiple platforms. Those posts would be considered original content and the following may not apply.

Crossposting from our Social Space to other platforms is fully permitted by us. Be aware, that the other platform may have guidelines regarding Crossposting. Crossposting from other platforms into our Social Space is only allowed under the following guidelines:

  • The posts do not include platform specific mentions or references, i.e talking about "here" referring to the other platform.
  • The Social Space account is at least semi-regularly monitored so that interactions on Mastodon are not ignored.
  • The accounts are both owned by the same person. Third party crossposting is not allowed.
  • Content from other accounts is not copied verbatim, i.e. quote tweets.

Multiple Accounts

You are allowed to have multiple accounts on our instance unless except for purposes that violate our Code of Conduct or other guidelines or for ban, suspension, or block evading.

Reporting Violations

To report a post on Mastodon, you can click the 3-dot menu button on a post and select report. From there, you can select the reason for the report along with additional posts to include. Next, you can specify more details for the report. Please include any details you think may help a moderator understand and make a decision about your report.

If the report is against a user from another instance, you'll also have the option to forward an anonymized copy of the report to that other instance. You should only do this if the post also violates that instances rules.

You may also follow any of the methods outlined in the Code of Conduct.

DMCA Complaints

For DMCA Complaints, you can find more information on our DMCA Information page.

Server Information

Our Mastodon is hosted by Leaseweb in Washington, D.C.

  • 8 GB RAM
  • 80 GB SSD
  • Backblaze B2 Cloud Storage for media

info.full_description:
Востаннє оновлено 2023-11-06

Вітання, Користуваче!

Запрошую до ознайомлення:

Перші кроки

  • Якщо ти знаєш що робити
    • 🤝
  • Якщо не розумієш що робити, але ти хочеш відразу до діла
    • Підпишись на адміна щоб бути в курсі про цей сервак https://lviv.social/@mluts
    • Подивись на кого краще підписатись https://lviv.social/explore/suggestions
      • Мінуси: багато дивних іноземців
      • Плюси: багато українців і прикольних людей
    • Почитай локальну стрічку https://lviv.social/public/local
      • Мінуси: схоже що на сервері найактивніша людина - адмін 🫣
      • Підказка: напиши перший пост з тегом #знайомство, тебе помітять і в тебе будуть нові підписники
    • Відкрий глобальну стрічку https://lviv.social/public
      • Плюси: постійно щось відбувається
      • Мінуси: забагато контенту
      • Підказка: користуйся кнопкою "приховати" в контекстному меню допису
      • Підказка: якщо побачиш русню - накатай скаргу
  • Якщо ти хочеш розібратися в темі
    • Якщо розумієш англійську: https://mastodon.help/
    • Українською:
      • Підпишись feditipsua@social.noleron.com
      • Почитай https://blog.noleron.com/

Про матеріально-технічну частину

  • Домен, база даних та сервер lviv.social належать пану Nepezpeka (@mluts).
  • Майно підтримується за власні кошти адміна.
  • День народження серверу - 2022 року 5 листопада. Також це день, коли виноситься рішення про продовження існування серверу ще на 2 роки.
  • Якщо адмін помре, втратить можливість утримувати сервер або прийме рішення більше не утримувати сервер, то адмін або його рідні люди мають подбати про те, щоб сервер перейшов у власність людини, яка продовжить виконувати обов'язки адміна.
  • Користуваче, пам'ятай! Ти завжди можеш перенести свій акаунт на інший сервер включно з підписниками, а також вивантажити весь свій контент з цього сервера з налаштувань в браузерній версії.
  • Обов'язок адміна, або тих хто тимчасово виконує його обов'язки - попередити всіх користувачів за 3 місяці до закриття серверу, якщо таке колись відбудеться.
  • В ідеальному світі цей сервер має жити вічно доки є воля користувачів до цього.

Про принципи модерації

  • Баланс диктатури і свободи слова.
  • Адмін-адмін і адмін-людина це різні ролі, я можу на вас образитись як людина, але це не приведе до вашого бану.
  • Російськомовність є небажаною, тому ваша думка висловлена російською мовою буде в меншому приорітеті, ніж іншою мовою. Найбільша увага приділяється українській мові.
  • Російське громадянство та будь-які прояви руснявості караються негайним вилученням всіх даних з серверу і пожиттєвим баном.

info.full_description:
About this server

This is a Norwegian mastodon instance and safe haven for social exchange between tech people from the University of Oslo, Norway. Despite that, this site has no affiliation nor it belongs to the University of Oslo.

It is also opened for other tech people and/or friends from around the world, but we have restrictions to posts in other languages (check our rules).

The name "babb" is because of the love for good kebabs that we share at USIT (University Center for Information Technology at the University of Oslo. On our team, we call them affectionally "babb".

It came to us that "babbe" is used pejoratively for immigrants in Sweden - which is kinda ironic, since the admin of this site has indeed and proudly, a foreign background.

Mastodon.oslo.no

All of our users can either identify themselves as @user@babb.no, @user@mastodon.babb.no and @user@mastodon.oslo.no.

Mastodon Server Covenant

We adhere 100% to the Mastodon Server Covenant. No racism, gender discrimination or anti-semitism will be tolerated.

We have daily backups, and @Gaelle has also access to the server infrastructure in case of emergency.

Transparency

This server runs on a kubernetes cluster with 6 nodes, 3 masters and 3 workers. Each machine has 14gb ram, but we might upgrade them accordingly should there be need for that.

Relays

We joined the following relays:

  • https://relay.babb.be - a relay for Norwegian instances
  • https://relay.intahnet.co.uk
  • https://relay.berserker.town
  • https://relay.instancias-br.online
  • https://relay.beckmeyer.us

Contact

If you need to contact us, send us an e-mail or a toot to @admin.

Blocked servers/instances

We are replicating blocked instances from mastodon.social.

info.full_description:
Über LEdiver.se

Für alle, die einen gut moderierten Server suchen. Ganz egal ob ihr aus eurem Alltag postet, euch für queere Rechte stark macht oder etwas ganz anderes teilen wollt. In Leipzig entstanden, offen für alle!

Administrator*innen und Moderator*innen sind @gcrkrause und @moanos_foss.

Wir sind offen für neue Menschen, hier könnt ihr euch einen Account erstellen: https://lediver.se/auth/sign_up

  • Über Finanzierung, Neuerungen, und Moderation bloggen wir unter https://blog.lediver.se/
  • Software die uns hilft diese Instanz zu betreuen findet ihr unter https://git.gieszer.link/Lediver.se/

Nutzungsbestimmungen

Es ist unsere Absicht, dass Du diesen Dienst zum persönlichen Vergnügen und für einen respektvollen, freundlichen Umgang miteinander nutzt. Zu diesem Zweck hoffen wir, ein einladendes und integratives Umfeld zu fördern.

Der Server ist in Privatbesitz und wird den Benutzer*innen freiwillig zur Verfügung gestellt, er ist kein öffentlicher Raum. Von Benutzer*innen, die dieser Gemeinschaft beitreten möchten, wird erwartet, dass sie ohne Böswilligkeit und in gutem Glauben handeln. Anderweitige Handlungen können zur Entfernung aus dem Dienst führen, unabhängig davon, ob ein Benutzi gegen die unten aufgeführten Regeln verstößt.

Der Server, auf dem die Instanz gehostet wird, befindet sich in Deutschland.

Die folgenden Aussagen gelten unabhängig vom Datenschutzniveau und der Instanz der beteiligten Benutzer*innen. In seltenen Fällen kann öffentliches oder privates Offline-Verhalten oder Verhalten auf einer separaten Instanz einen Grund für die Entfernung aus dem Dienst darstellen.

Richtlinien und Regeln

Unsere Instanz unterliegt einer Reihe von Regeln für das Benutzer*innenverhalten. Die Regeln sind immer auf unserer About-Seite und in unserem öffentlichen Repository sichtbar.

Diese Regeln sollen eine freundliche und offene Atmosphäre aufrechterhalten und Belästigung und Diskriminierung verhindern. Als solche sind sie eine Reihe von Richtlinien, aber notwendigerweise unvollständig. Benutzer*innen, die gegen den Geist dieser Regeln verstoßen, werden nicht anders behandelt als Benutzer*innen, die gegen eine bestimmte Regel verstoßen.

Bitte beachtet, dass unsere Regeln einen Abschnitt über bewährte Praktiken enthalten, und Benutzer*innen, die wiederholt und trotz Warnungen diese bewährten Praktiken missachten, können als Verstöße gegen unsere Regeln angesehen werden.

Die Moderatoren können Konten entfernen, die die Instanz spammen oder bei denen der Verdacht besteht, dass dieser allein dem Zweck dient, einen Accountnamen zu reservieren. Verstöße gegen die Richtlinien und Regeln können nach dem Ermessen der Moderatoren auch zur Entfernung von Konten führen.

Zugang zu Daten

Inhalte auf dieser Instanz dürfen ohne die ausdrückliche Zustimmung der beteiligten Nutzer*innen nicht für die Zwecke des maschinellen Lernens oder andere “Forschungszwecke” verwendet werden.

Inhalte auf dieser Instanz, die über diese Seite hinausgehen, dürfen von keinem Benutzer*innen oder Dienst in großem Umfang mit automatisierten Mitteln archiviert oder indexiert werden. Aktive Benutzer*innen können ihre folgenden Listen und Beiträge über den Export auf ihrer Einstellungsseite oder über die API exportieren.

Verhaltensregeln gegen Belästigung

Inhalte, die die Unterdrückung einer marginalisierte Gruppe fördern, sind verboten. Wir werde diese Gruppen verteidigen und weder hasserfüllte Sprache noch negative Rhetorik tolerieren, die sich gegen Gruppen richtet, die sozial ausgegrenzt werden. Zu diesen Personen können Mitglieder von Gruppen gehören, die im Folgenden definiert werden. Diese Liste ist notwendigerweise unvollständig.

  • ethnische Zugehörigkeit
  • Gender-Identität und -Ausdruck
  • sexuelle Identität und Orientierung
  • Alter oder körperliche Merkmale
  • Behinderung oder Krankheit
  • Einwanderer- oder Flüchtlingsstatus
  • Gesundheit, Reichtum oder Bildungsstand
  • Nationalität, Wohnsitz oder Staatsbürgerschaftsstatus
  • Glauben, oder kein Glauben zu haben.

Wir hoffen, dass unser Nutzer*innen nicht schweigen und wegsehen, wenn andere belästigt werden. Wir sind eine Community und sollten uns alle für ein angenehmes und faires Miteinander einsetzen. Lieber einmal mehr einen Vorfall melden als einmal zu wenig.

Außerdem ausdrücklich verboten sind:

  • Inhalte, die eine marginalisierte Gruppe oder ein Individuum bedrohen oder zu Selbstgewalt oder Selbstverletzung ermutigen.
  • Verhalten zur Förderung der Ideologien des Faschismus, des Nationalsozialismus, der weißen Vorherrschaft oder anderer gewalttätiger oder fremdenfeindlicher Standpunkte.
  • Symbole und Slogans, die mit diesen Gruppen in Verbindung stehen, sollten nicht beiläufig oder in scherzhafter Weise verwendet werden.
  • Fortsetzung einer Conversation mit einer Benutzer*in, die darum gebeten hat diese Unterhaltung zu beenden.
  • Stalking und Doxing werden unter keinen Umständen toleriert. Bitte meldet beide Verhaltensweisen sofort einem Moderator.
  • Handlungen, die darauf abzielen, der Leistung dieser Instanz zu schaden, sowie das Eintreten für diese oder andere Instanzen oder die Aufforderung an andere, dies zu tun.
  • Absichtlich Personen mit falschem Namen oder Deadname zu benennen (Ein Deadname ist ein abgelegter, alter Vorname)
  • Inhalte aller Art die illegal nach dem deutschen Gesetzt sind.
  • Einrichtung eines Kontos mit dem Zweck, Verbote, Stummschaltungen oder Blockierungen zu umgehen

Lokale Timeline

  • Posts auf der lokalen Timeline brauchen CWs (Inhaltswarnungen) für Gewalt, Sex, Nacktheit, Tod/Krankheit und Politik (insbesondere bei negativen oder kontroversen Themen). Auch mit einem CW Das sind nur die Kategorien, eine CW könnte also z.B. “depol, Wahlen” sein. Wir wissen, dass Grenzen hier nicht trennscharf sind. Insbesondere beim Thema Politik werden wir mit euch erstmal in einen Austausch gehen. Explizit ausgenommen von der Regel ist die Schilderung von eigenen Erfahrung von Menschen marginalisierter Gruppen. Hier wird diese Regel NICHT gelten.
  • Posts auf der lokalen Timeline brauchen Bildbeschreibungen.

Konsequenzen bei Regelverstößen

Bei einem Verstoß gegen die oben aufgelisteten Regeln können nach Kenntnisnahme durch das Moderationsteam unter anderem Folgende Maßnahmen ergriffen werden:

  • Kommunikation mit dem*r Nutzer*in
  • Entfernung des Inhalts.
  • Markierung des Inhalts als sensitiv.
  • Stummschalten, Blockieren oder Löschen des Accounts.

Die Auswahl der Konsequenzen obliegt allein dem Moderationsteam.

info.full_description:
@PostPandemicParty.org

“I am in the world to change the world.” —Kathe Kollwitz

This is a home base for relatively like-minded folks to land in the #TwitterMigration. Likeminded, how? In the middle of 2020, the world ground to a halt and was turned on its head. At that point, many were ready to admit that the systems running our world ==> are systems running humans (and this planet) into the ground. If you had that moment of reflection, the PostPandemicParty might be the homebase for you to land in.

If can see that the society you live in was formed in the image of white supremacy, and is still steeped in it, then this might be the homebase for you.

If you believe a multi-racial/multi-ethnic democracy is ‘a more perfect union’ that we were dedicated to form (and that this is possible), that #BlackLivesMatter, that you're standing on #NativeLand, then this might be the homebase for you.

If you believe in liberation more than charity or philanthropy, and would support oppressed people to lead the way to achieve their liberation, then this might be for you.

If you're sick and tired of [racism, settler colonialism, misogyny, religious extremism, homophobia, transphobia, nationalism, anti-semitism, xenophobia], and of being sick & tired, this might be the place for you.

If you try to leave a better planet than you inherited, even if you know that the institution/corporation/academy where you work is steeped in a history of these oppressions, this might be for you.

If you're a human who believes in things like the above but also sometimes makes a human mistake, has messed up on a person's pronouns or said something ableist and apologized, or been called-in for an implicit bias you never examined before... and you are OK with becoming a better person and self-aware enough to learn from experiences, you might be home.

If you grapple with these contradictions, because the human condition is messy, welcome.

*It's not coincidence that we quote a Black woman and scholar above: BIPOC folks are listened to, uplifted in, and leaders of this Party.

On this instance you might find professors, scholars, educators, digital humanists, human rights lawyers, ethicists, feminists, cartographers, designers, feminist cartographers and designers, archivists, librarians, poets, artists, activists, artist-activists, creative coders, public historians, museum professionals, organizers, journalists, archeologists, and a hundred other careers that people can hold. They might post about their projects, they might post links, they might post cute dog pics/cat pics/chinchilla pics, or they might post about a heck of a day they are having. There's no suggested "on-topic".

Rationale

The #TwitterMigration won't happen all at once; it might ebb and flow as the tenor of Twitter degrades over time. Or maybe, it won't be as big an exodus as we thought. This instance was set up in October 2022 to be operational in case/when people find the need to move some of their energies off that corporate platform.

Also, one doesn't need to move their life wholesale off Twitter. It's possible to still tweet at/keep tabs on the Trending Topics & politicians & institutions of the world, while deciding that your personal posts (and quest for community) can be better served somewhere else.

There are several Mastodon instances geared towards people in tech (octodon.social, fosstodon.org, indieweb.social, hachyderm.io, tech.lgbt). Scholar.social caters to academics, but discourages people from posting about their personal lives. Weirder.earth might be one I would pick. Yet I could not find a Mastodon instance that seemed home to folks who are politicized by the corruption of our governing systems, who advocate for structural change, and in so doing are already practicing respect for the diversity of humans who show up to the table.

This instance is called a Party in the sense of a Big Tent that covers people no matter what their specific interests are (cooking, birding, aerial arts, tech, data viz, maps, genealogy, higher ed, whatever!). But parties form around a value system that its members want to see in the world. We want to foster a community here that starts from a set of shared values.

Quick Primer on Mastodon: You aren't just siloed on this community

Abridged from mastodon.help.

Mastodon is open-source software for letting microbloggers worldwide engage with each other, while being decentralized and noncommercial. Every instance has its own server, rules, admins, and moderation. So the social norms for posting vary locally across servers. The administrators on each instance are the ones who can block, mute or suspend accounts who violate their standards.

Your Mastodon username will be in the format of @username@Instance

It really doesn't matter what Instance you register on if you are OK by their posting rules.

You can still Follow, Boost (≈retweet), DM, and reply to people the world over, because these servers are federated on a common protocol. (Think of your Instance as the area code of your phone number; your number can still call anyone else in the world.) If you want to change Instances in the future, it is possible to transfer all your data including toots (≈tweets), followers and blocked users list.

However, there is one advantage within your Instance: Mastodon's UI provides a Local Timeline as well as your Federated Timeline. That means if you are embedded in a like-minded community, you are likely to discover interesting posts/conversations/links just within the Local feed, without the outside noise. Plus, the directory of users will be people you will probably find interesting. This also means that instances with 10K+ users are not necessarily BETTER — at that point, the noise is back in your Local feed and is not really much different than the Federated Timeline. So small & medium-sized instances might actually be a better experience.

Mastodon's functionality is a lot like Twitter, but it is not the same. First, you get 500 characters, not 280. Second, your Feed is in chronological order; it is not manipulated by an algorithm. Mastodon has a Content Warning (CW) feature available with every post you make. It’s an optional mask that covers the content of your post with a warning message that you can customize.

on Twitteron Mastodonbut...
TweetToot
RetweetBoostbut you can't Quote Tweet
Quote Tweet—To add your 2¢ you have to reply into the author's thread. This was a Mastodon design decision to foster real discussions, less-so talking about someone else.
LikeFavourite (Star)but starring won't help it appear in your followers' feed
DMsDMshere it's really just a toot with the privacy set to 'Mentioned Person Only'. There's a separate tab for viewing them, but it's much less like an Inbox
Elon MuskNo one owns itit's open-source, and hence decentralized

Most importantly, Mastodon is NOT a direct Twitter-replacement. It's a social media platform to be home to its own discussions. You shouldn't use Mastodon just to echo/post the stuff that outrages you on Twitter, and you are not rewarded here for the number of Stars (≈likes) or Boosts (≈retweets) you get. Just to know how many times a certain post was Boosted or favorited you must click on it; but there is no emphasis on it, and in fact, nobody really cares. Mastodon seems focused on having actual conversations about the topic you're posting about. See what other people reply, and add to your understanding of this crazy world we are in.

The following mindsets from Twitter do not translate well here: The emotional/social gratification in the # of retweets I get. Writing posts to get likes. Quote Tweeting to add my pile-on. What are the Trending Topics (imposing today’s obligatory pile-on)? Who should I follow?

Instead on Mastodon: Think ‘who would I interact with?’ Write posts that are interesting, to stimulate discussion and interaction.

Finally, to be clear: never assume that there is 100% privacy in the Fediverse. Every Instance runs on a computer server, and the admins ultimately have the ability (even if not used) to examine everything stored on that server. If you think of your posts as a postcard you send through the digital mail, not a sealed envelope, then you should be okay. If you ever need true privacy, move your communications to another messaging platform like TXT, Signal, WhatApp, etc.

Server operations

This instance is hosted through Masto.host on a server located in France. For the time being, the time and cost of operation is being paid by auut studio to jumpstart this home. As the community size grows, we may implement a way for users to contribute $1 toward costs, and to create a shared governance for moderation. Remember, any site that you want to stick around for the long haul is something you will probably need to contribute to. ‘Free’ services close shop all the time; or they are ‘free’ because you are paying the corporation with ownership of your data.

The PostPandemicParty will federate with everything that doesn't support spam, hate speech, hateful ideology, negative or threatening behaviour, fascism and proto-fascism, extremism, or child pornography... we'll block all that shit to shield our users from hate. In short, we don't argue with people that Tubman would have shot.

We restrict the default visibility of posts coming from instances known for NSFW content, so that our users can use this instance at work. More information can be found in the section Moderated Servers below.

Server rules

Below is a summary of rules that govern the PostPandemicParty instance. You need to follow this if you want to have an account on this server:

  1. Come to this forum in a spirit of community — to share your wisdom and unique talents, to make connections, to gather feedback, to learn from other people's wisdom and unique talents — and you are 90% of the way there.
  2. On public timelines, a content warning (CW) or proper tagging is required for nudity and violence, and any historical racist imagery that you are analyzing or critiquing. CWs are recommended for anything commonly traumatic.
  3. Spamming with links and straight-up advertising your commercial services is not allowed. But feel free to share your projects and what you are excited to be working on!
  4. Do not harass anyone, participate in group harassment or pile-on of anyone on this instance, or otherwise engage in name-calling and personal attacks. If you are feeling antagonistic, take a breather and log off. Come back and critique ideas, but not the person. Posting or threatening to post other people’s personally identifying information (“doxxing”) constitutes harassment. Unwelcome sexual attention (including sexualized comments or jokes) constitutes harassment.
  5. There's going to be zero tolerance for slurs or hateful language; racist, sexist, classist, homophobic, transphobic, ableist, or otherwise discriminatory jokes. You'll get banned. If deep in your heart you believe there are some people who deserve more human rights than others (à la white supremacy, misogyny, misogynoir, anti-Blackness, anti-Semitism, nationalism, settler colonialism, settler colonialism in the name of Zionism, transphobia, “poor people are lazy”, “sex workers are bad people”, or any other hateful ideology), go find another instance to express that and save us both the time.
  6. Automated tools (like bots) are allowed if they post less than ~once a week, and you are actively participating in the replies that people engage with it. Unmonitored bot accounts that post automatically are not acceptable.
  7. Direct employees or contractors for any of the following types of organizations are not welcome here: Police, Immigration enforcement, State Intelligence/Private investigation firms. Individuals working for such will be banned.

info.short_description: This is a private server run by and for the benefit of a small group of friends. Academia and research, law and policy, society and the Internet. Contact: Michael Veale.
info.full_description:
The server is small-scale and invite only. Its population is mostly interested in varying intersections of law, policy, technology and society, and includes a range of academics, civil society and journalists.

Although we are a closed server, we follow the criteria of the Mastodon server covenant.

  1. Active moderation against racism, sexism, homophobia and transphobia

  2. Daily backups

  3. At least one other person with emergency access to the server infrastructure

  4. Commitment to give users at least 3 months of advance warning in case of shutting down

We support the server through donations on LiberaPay. Denizens are suggested to donate €20/year.

Initially, we thought the pun "There's No Cloud, There's Only Someone Else's Computer" is attributable to @fsfe@mastodon.social, who have used it for at least a decade, and put it on stickers and t-shirts. We have since received a competing claim from @gcluley@mastodon.green, who claims he came up with the pun and was using it in the media in 2013. Either way, we appreciate the phrase, encourage everyone too think about the material conditions of computing, and presume the joke is implicitly governed by a strong copyleft license, and you should too.

Automated Scraping

Only initiatives run by non-profit or public sector libraries desiged to preserve Internet content for the public interest, including specifically the Internet Archive and perma.cc and organisations with with highly similar goals, have permission from the administrator to archive the contents originating from someone.elses.computer. The administrator does not own the copyright over the contents of the posts from the users of someone.elses.computer, and this therefore cannot be considered as a copyright license.

Not-for-profit services that index users in the Fediverse are permitted to scrape someone.elses.computer or access its APIs and retain data for the sole purpose of increasing discoverability of its users.

Non-profit research projects may be permitted to scrape someone.elses.computer, but we require all studies to undertake local research ethics approaches (such as a REC or IRB submission) and research ethics documentation being submitted to the research institution in question must be submitted in advance for approval to mail at someone dot elses dot computer for such approval to be granted.

For clarity, all users of someone.elses.computer do not give any implicit consent, and express objection by default until specifically clarified otherwise, for research-based data processing operations.

Über uns

Diese Instanz wurde vom Innovationsbeirat inspiriert, einem ideellen Netzwerk von Neudenkern mit dem Antrieb offene Innovation in Organisationen zu bringen.

Der Leitsatz der Noisebridge in San Francisco "be excellent to each other" bringt es für uns auch hier auf den Punkt:

Wer mehr zu uns erfahren möchte, dem sei unser Open First Manifest ans Herz gelegt:

https://innovationsbeirat.de/open-first/

General Info

The Howlr Social Networking Instance ("Howlr") exists to provide members of marginalized, niche, and alternative lifestyle communities a forum of discussion, socialization, and platform for action. Although we focus on the alternative, all beings with an inclusive mindset are welcome on Howlr. We aim to both give people the ability to speak freely about a number of topics, including controversial ones, as well as provide a safe-space free from harassment and unwelcome behavior.

History

Howlr was founded in 2021 by Naia Ōkami as a safe haven for members of niche and marginalized communities. Following Elon Musk's purchase of Twitter and policy decisions made on the site as a result, @naia and many of her friends and acquaintances began using Howlr as a primary form of social media. info.full_description:
Paravielfalt.zone ist eine Instanz für paraphile Menschen und alle, die sich wegen ihrer sexuellen Identität aus der Gesellschaft ausgegrenzt fühlen.

Wir glauben daran, dass sexuelle Präferenzen keine Aussage über den Charakter einer Person machen und niemand wegen seiner Gefühle ausgegrenzt oder verurteilt werden sollte. Verschiedene sexuelle Präferenzen und Paraphilien sind keine Störung und kein Fehler, sondern Ausdruck der menschlichen Diversität und Vielfalt – Paravielfalt eben.

Das Ziel dieser Instanz ist es, einen Safe Space für respektvolle Debatten und gegenseitige Unterstützung zu bieten. Wir heißen Menschen aller sexuellen Identitäten willkommen, einschließlich Pädophile, Zoophile, Nekrophile, queere Menschen und Andere.

Hinweis: in der Vergangenheit sind wir immer wieder Ziel von Desinformationskampagnen geworden, die behaupten, dass hier illegale Inhalte verbreitet werden. Das ist nicht der Fall – siehe auch Serverregel 4.

English Version

Paravielfalt.zone is an instance for paraphilic people and everyone who feels excluded from society because of their sexual identity.

We believe that sexual preferences do not make a statement about a person's character, and that no one should be excluded or judged because of their feelings. Different sexual preferences and paraphilias are not a disorder or a sickness, but an expression of human diversity. The German name for diversity is "Vielfalt" – hence the name "Paravielfalt".

This instance is dedicated to providing a safe space for respectful debates and mutual support. We welcome people of all sexual identities, including pedophiles, zoophiles, necrophiles, queer people, and others.

Note: in the past we have frequently been the target of disinformation campaigns wrongly accusing us of distributing illegal material. This is a lie. We do not allow pornografic content, and anything illegal will be deleted and reported by us immediatly.

Welcome to MontereyBay.social!

Established November 2022

From Santa Cruz to Salinas, Monterey to Bonny Doon, we live in an amazing area. MontereyBay.social is the place for locals to hang out and talk about who we are and why we make this our home.

Concerned about joining a smaller community? Here are a couple of articles that talk about why you might want to consider a local instance:

  • @seb wrote about Regional Instances, Federation, and Scalability on the SFBA.social blog.
  • Aram Zucker-Scharff makes a case for Why you should find the Mastodon instance that works for you on his blog.

You can find more detailed information about MontereyBay.social and the team behind this instance on hub.montereybay.social.

Moderation

Submit moderation requests to @paul@montereybay.social or support@montereybay.social. Please be familiar with the Server Rules listed below as they will be enforced. Our privacy policy is also available.

No discrimination against unhoused people

I acknowledge that this is an unusual rule. I specifically call out hate speech against homeless individuals for two reasons:

  1. In the United States, there are few if any social consequences to openly discriminating against the unhoused. Discrimination leads to poor physical and mental health outcomes and is recognized as a violation of human rights by the United Nations.
  2. My family has direct, lived experience with homelessness. My spouse works for a nonprofit that provides services to unhoused people. We believe that housing is a right.

What you post on other social networks is your own business, of course.

Moving to a new account

Here are some useful resources if you are moving here from another Mastodon instance:

  • Patricia Aas has written a concise guide to moving to a new Mastodon server.
  • @MastodonMigration@mastodon.online regularly posts tips on how to move as well as interesting statistics.
  • The official Mastodon docs also have a page on migrating from one server to another.

More information

To submit a DMCA request, contact @paul@montereybay.social or support@obscure.com.

Welcome to The Zone

ChillPeep.Zone is a Mastodon instance owned and operated by a group of friends, The Chill Peep Zone. This is our space on the fediverse to post, chill and interact with others. We're an open and LGBTQ+ friendly instance, open to furries, artists and techies!

We are an 18+ server. Although we are not primarily an NSFW server, our users are free to discuss topics such as sexuality and adult content

Content Policy

As we're mainly a SFW instance, any NSFW content must be tagged with an appropriate content warning. Avatars and banners cannot contain any NSFW content. In addition, all content must not violate UK or German law.

In order to operate a safe instance, users must aged 18 or above.

If you find any content posted by our members that breaks our policies or think the post should be brought to our attention, please report it via Mastodon's reporting system. You will not be penalized for using the report system correctly.

We follow the Mastodon Server Covenant, so your user data and media are backed up daily to multiple encrypted offsite locations and we will notify you at least 3 months in advance if we need to shutdown

Federation Policy

chillpeep.zone aims to federate with instances that are generally respectful and that have good moderation policies. Public timelines are being monitored for content that breaks our policies. If an instance is found to be posting content that violates our policies, we may choose to silence or suspend the instance based on the severity of the violation.

If you believe your instance has been suspended unfairly, please reach out to the admin email above

Hosting costs

For transparency with our community, here's how much it costs to run chillpeep.zone per month (accurate as of 2023-05-23)

  • VPS (Hetzner) - £23.27
  • Storage (Cloudflare R2) - £4.97

chillpeep.zone will ALWAYS be free to use, and we will NEVER force our users to look at ads or pay a subscription to use this service. This server is volunteer ran, we're not backed by a huge company or some egotistical billionaire.

🤝 Joining Baka Social 🤝

This server is invite only/Application only.

VRChat creators are welcome to apply! Videos, photography, avatars, worlds!~

Please post a tweet or make mention of your application on your socials, so we can verify who you are! Something like "I'm joining Baka Social at @myusername@baka.social", or even just "I'm applying for a Baka Social account!" if you use the same username on both sites this is all we need. You can also add your @myusername@baka.social ID to your bio instead. Please link to the post/tweet/bio when you apply, and tell us what you did if it's not obvious, so we can verify you quickly! This helps us make sure the person creating the account is not an imposter claiming to be you. On top of this, we will review this account using internal standards to identify which accounts are the right fit with BakaSocial.

If you are a very new creator and just getting started. You can join any server you wish over at Joinmastodon.org and reapply in the future to transfer your account!

When you request an account, please tell us:

  • A little bit about yourself and what you do (just one sentence or two is enough)
  • A link to your verification post/page (you need to mention your Baka Social username there!)
  • A link to your existing content

🫂 What about close friends? 🫂

Social networks are most fun with your close friends! As a verified creator, you will be able to invite your close friends into the instance to come and hang out!

Creators inviting their close friends MUST ensure they read the instance rules and abide by them.

Abuse of the invite system and inviting malicious users could result in loss of invite permissions as well as administrative action depending on the situation.

🏟️What about fans?🏟️

Because of how the fediverse works. Fans and creators can connect regardless of what server they belong to!. We want to ensure Baka Social focuses on ensuring that this is a trusted and safe place for creators. Please visit Joinmastodon.org to find a server right for you!.

🔨 Moderation 🔨

Moderation of this server is based on interpretation of content posted to the server against our published rules.

Please report by clicking ... menu, and selecting report.

When reporting accounts, please make sure to include at least a few posts that show rule-breaking behavior's, when applicable. If there is any additional context that might help make a decision, please also include it in the comment. This is especially important when the content is in a language nobody on the moderation team speaks.

DMCA requests also are to be sent to reporting@baka.social. These must follow proper reporting procedure as per 17 U.S.C. 512 (c)(3).

⛑️🦺 Status updates 🦺⛑️

We have a page showing uptime and server status at status.baka.social

This server hereby pledges to adhere to the Mastodon Server Covenant

One additional thing I would like to provide to help keep our promise is proof of reserves.

Instance admins have access to the following bitcoin wallet which anyone at any time can verify the balance of: bc1qc2hwjwnrvjnsyhsdupz5p69wq8wmg6wj03p9ep

This wallet will be used in the event that something were to happen to Dalek and should cover well over 3 months of hosting fees even if we upgraded our instance and has some extra to account for price fluctuations in bitcoin.

📦🚚 Migrating? 🚚📦

Whether you wish to migrate to or from BakaSocial, we would like you to have an easy experience doing so!. The below video is by far one of the easiest guides to follow on migrating your account!

When you migrate your account, you take with you the people you follow and your followers!

info.full_description:
LGBTQIA+ (CZ) Mastodon

O serveru

Mikroblogovací platforma především pro české LGBTQIA+ lidi a spojence (allies). Registrace podléhá schvalování. Naše hodnoty: respekt k druhým a netolerance netolerance. Technicky provozuje kolektiv NoLog.cz, moderuje (zatím) hlavně Kayla.

Provoz (nikoli moderace) je umožněn díky darům podporovatelů a podporovatelek kolektivu NoLog.cz - pokud se k nim chcete přidat, máte možnost tak udělat na tomto odkazu.

Podrobná pravidla pro diskuze a příspěvky na serveru jsou níže na této stránce v sekci "Pravidla serveru".

Registrace

S ohledem na častější vystavení LGBTQIA+ lidí různým formám slovního i fyzického násilí a s tím i související jejich stále nerovnoprávné postavení v české společnosti (příkladem je třeba neexistence manželství pro všechny nebo zákonem uložená kastrace trans lidí), jsme se rozhodli, že registrace bude pouze na schválení.

Aby Vám byla registrace co nejpravděpodobněji schválena:

  • použijte rozumnou přezdívku - přezdívky od pohledu zkoušející porušení pravidel přispívání na server nebudou schváleny zcela určitě
  • do formuláře s otázkou "Proč se chcete připojit?" vyplňte nejen váš důvod, ale i jestli vám vyhovují pravidla serveru a hodláte je respektovat
  • do formuláře můžete přidat odkaz na svůj veřejný profil na jiné sociální síti (není podmínkou)

Berte ohled na to, že moderace i schvalování registrací jsou dobrovolnickou aktivitou, proto mohou chvíli trvat. Rozhodnutí o schválení či neschválení je na našem uvážení.

Moderace a blokované servery

Moderace probíhá podle pravidel v sekci "Pravidla serveru" rozkliknutelných níže na stránce. Moderační tým se bude rozšiřovat, stabilizovat a upřesňovat postupem času s růstem serveru - ideálně rekrutovat z aktivních uživatelů, kteří mají jasný a dlouhodobý pozitivní přínos k diskusím.

Tento server je součástí fediverse, obří sítě různorodých serverů zaměřených na různá témata a formáty komunikace - mikroblogy, blogy, videa nebo sdílení fotografií, propojených ActivityPub protokolem. To znamená, že můžete sledovat účty z jiných serverů a ony mohou sledovat vás.

Nicméně s ohledem na to, že některé takové servery jsou známými a velkými zdroji dezinformací, propagují "svobodu slova" za každou cenu - tedy i za cenu těžkého a rozsáhlého porušování pravidel definovaných na našem serveru, rozhodli jsme se, že takové servery budeme rovnou blokovat a to primárně na základě seznamu našim pravidlům blízkému serveru chaos.social - viz list of blocked instances. Celkový přehled blokovaných serverů je k dispozici přihlášeným uživatelům ve spodní části této stránky.

Präambel

Regeln für die Nutzung dieses Servers gelten nur, wenn sie eindeutig und widerspruchsfrei sind, sowie in Einklang stehen mit den moralischen Ansprüchen der Menschheit.

Selbstbeschreibung

Interaktion, Organisation und Gesellschaft schräg von der Seite ansehen. Geht das? Und obwohl es nicht geht, wie geht es nicht nicht? Diese Instanz ist Zettelkasten und Experimentierfeld.

Regeln

IfWO.eu ist eine Mastodon-Instanz und als solche ein Teil des Fediverse. IfWO.eu ist an der Möglichkeit des Austausches mit möglichst vielen anderen Instanzen interessiert. Um zu gewährleisten, dass ifwo.eu von anderen Instanzen nicht geblockt und stattdessen als vertrauenswürdige Instanz akzeptiert wird und damit sich die auf der Instanz etablierten Nutzenden wohl fühlen können, moderieren wir aktiv. Nazis, Antisemitismus, Islamfeindlichkeit und andere Formen von ätzendem Verhalten gegen Menschen werden nicht toleriert. Ausdrücklich willkommen sind hier Cyborgs, Non-Binary, LGBTQ, BIPoC. Neben dem "Owner" @sozialwelten gibt es zwei Moderatorinnen, die helfen, dass auf Meldungen immer schnell reagiert wird.

Geblockte Instanzen

Über mehrere Jahre hat der IfWO "Owner" @sozialwelten andere Instanzen restriktiv geblockt, insbesondere bei zwingendem und konkretem Anlass, wie der Verbreitung illegaler Inhalte und fehlende Maßnahmen der Instanz dagegen. Durch das Wachstum der Nutzendenzahlen des Fediverse im Verhältnis zu früheren Zeiten, die dadurch vermehrten Aktivitäten böswilliger Akteure, zur Absicherung der Verantwortlichkeiten der Administration der Instanz und durch die gestiegene Zahl an Nutzenden auf der IfWO.eu Plattform und deren Schutzinteressen wurden zusätzliche Maßnahmen notwendig. Neben Einzelfallentscheidungen verwendet @sozialwelten zwei sehr gängige Blocklisten fast vollständig: Gardenfence und fedinuke.txt von Seirdy. Instanzen für Shitposting und NSFW-Postings, die im Hinblick auf problematische (illegale) Inhalte moderieren, werden nicht geblockt.

Anmeldung und Nutzung

Gerne würde @sozialwelten die Registrierung freigeben, nur leider melden sich dann zu viele (Crypto-Spam) Bots an. Aktuell muss daher jede Registrierung manuell freigeschaltet werden. @sozialwelten freut sich über eine kurze Begründung, hauptsächlich um auschließen zu können, dass es sich um einen Spamaccount handelt. In der Regel werden neue Accounts innerhalb von 24 Stunden zugelassen.

Was bislang geschah

Die Instanz diente @sozialwelten anfänglich, um eine persönliche Sammlung an Tröts zur dauerhaften Verfügbarkeit anzulegen. Über die Verwendung von Hashtags entstanden dabei Verknüpfungen, womit Begriffe inhaltlich unterfüttert wurden. Thematisch handelte es sich um Notizen zu Lektüre, Gespräche und Begegnungen unter anderem aus den Feldern Soziologie, Sozialökonomie und Politik. Dieses spezifische Verhalten wird fortgesetzt, betrifft jedoch lediglich den Account von @sozialwelten. Andere Instanzen sind hiermit freundlich gebeten, die Instanz IfWO.eu nicht aufgrund dieses Verhaltens zu blocken. Mittlerweile haben sich auch andere Nutzende auf dieser Instanz angemeldet, aus Neugierde, wegen persönlicher Bekanntschaft oder auch eher zufällig, teils ohne Vorerfahrungen mit dem Fediverse. Im laufe der Zeit sind auch Nutzende abgeschalteter Instanzen dazu gekommen. IfWO.eu soll ein gut vernetzter und freundlicher Knotenpunkt im (insbesondere deutschsprachigen) Fediverse sein. Auf gute Nachbarschaft!

Unterstützung und Finanzierung

Es besteht die Möglichkeit, sich an der Finanzierung von IfWO zu beteiligen, indem man einen kleinen Obulus in einen Ko-Fi Hut wirft. Neben der Mastodon Instanz IfWO.eu gibt es aktuell auch noch IfWO Peertube, Matrix und Gitea, die für etablierte Nutzende der IfWO Mastodon-Instanz zur Verfügung stehen. Alle Dienste im Zusammenhang mit IfWO bleiben unkommerziell - also ohne die Absicht Gewinne zu erzielen. Vielen Dank für Eure Unterstützung!

Alles Weitere ist Learning By Doing. Keine Angst und keine Schuld.
Vielen Dank für Anregungen und Hinweise!

Michael (Sozialwelten)
