info.full_description:
LGBTQPlus.social

Über uns

Wir sind LGBTQPlus.social. Eine deutschsprachige Mastodon Instanz, welche hier einen perfekten Schutz für queere Personen bietet. Bei uns gilt eine Null-Toleranz bei Diskriminierung gegenüber queeren Personen.
Bei uns kann sich jede queere Person ausleben, jedoch gilt trotzdem das Regelwerk zu beachten, da hier auch gegebenenfalls minderjährige queere Jugendliche unterwegs sind.
Dieser Instanz dient nicht dazu, NSFW-Inhalte zu verbreiten oder zu veröffentlichen.

Custom CSS

Von @rolle@mentomori.social

Das Team

ADMINISTRATION
@admin - Verwaltungsaccount
@kai - Administrator und Leiter von LGBTQPlus.social
@Quama - Administrator
MODERATION

Personen können sich jederzeit unter apply@lgbtqplus.social mit dem Betreff "Bewerbung | Moderation" bewerben.

Impressum

"LGBTQPlus.social"
Cloudagunt
Bessemerstraße 82
12103 Berlin


Administration | admin@lgbtqplus.social
Support | support@lgbtqplus.social - @hilfe

Kosten, Transparenz & Uptime

KOSTEN
"lgbtqplus.social" ist ein kostenfreier und werbefreier Dienst von Kai. Dafür fallen folgende Kosten an:
- die lgbtqplus.social für 38,00 € bei Cloudagunt.de
- der Cloudserver für LGBTQPlus.social beträgt 12,80€ bei MyLOC.de

SPENDEN

Wir nehmen Spenden gerne entgegen, dafür gibt es verschiedene Möglichkeiten:
1. PayPal:
Über PayPal mit dem Link paypal.me/kaisau mit dem Betreff: "USERNAME | Mastodon".
2. Paysafecard (PSC) Deutschland:
Solltest du eine Paysafecard haben und keine Verwendung dafür haben, kannst du sie uns gerne zuschicken über admin@lgbtqplus.social.
3. Banküberweisung:
Du möchtest uns unbedingt was spenden? Dann kannst du dies auch gerne per Banküberweisung tun. Melde dich bei mir @kai oder per Mail admin@lgbtqplus.social
Wir haben von folgenden Personen senden erhalten:
- @lena161 - 5€

UPTIME
Die Uptime von unseren Diensten kann man immer unter status.lgbtqplus.social nachschauen. Es wird eine 99,9% Uptime garantiert von uns. Der Prozentsatz kann abweichen, wenn unvorhersehbare Ausfälle durch unsere Provider auftreten und/oder dringend notwendige Wartungsarbeiten vorgenommen werden müssen.
Eine Downtime versuchen wir immer vorher anzukündigen, damit sich unsere Benutzer*innen darauf vorbereiten können.

Backups & Hosting

BACKUPS
Wir erstellen täglich mind. 2 Backups von unserer Instanz, welche bei Hetzner lagert werden.

HOSTING

Unsere Instanz steht bei myloc.de, welches ein deutsches Rechenzentrum in Düsseldorf ist.
Alle Medien-Dateien werden bei Backblaze Inc gesichert und tägliche Backups davon gemacht.

Blockierte Instanzen/Mailanbieter

BLOCKIERTE MAILANBIETER

  • protonmail.com/proton.me
  • Temp-Mail anbieter

    Dieser Schutz, der blockierten Mailanbieter, dient dafür, dass wir "ungewollte" Personen damit verhindern möchte und eine Umgehung einer Sperre eines Kontos somit verhindern möchten.
    Sollten Mailanbieter blockiert worden sein, welcher als dein Hauptmail Anbieter dient, dann melde dich bitte unter admin@lgbtqplus.social oder wähle eine anderen Mailanbieter. Vielen Dank für das Verständnis.

Danksagungen

Wir bedanken uns bei Christian für die Hilfe der Erstellung & Problemlösung.

Da wir ein sehr junger Mastodon Instanzen sind, haben wir uns teilweise von anderen Mastodon Servern inspirieren lassen. Wir haben Inhalte und Strukturen mitunter übernommen.

info.full_description:
This server will never be bigger than 100 people. That said, as long as the applications are open, we still have room. If you think you'd feel at home here, please apply!

A note from the admin: I'd like Club Unstraight to be a kind place, and you can't be kind without being vulnerable. During the application process you will be asked to introduce the person and the passion. You introduce the person by writing about three events that shaped you into the person you are today, and the passion by writing about things you'd like to discuss. Each answer should be max 500 characters, as these will be your pinned introduction toots.

We are a mastodon instance for DJs of various kinds and related fields, be it in the club, radio or mobile sound-systems.

This is a social space without ads, companies, and especially without algorithms. Do let the community know about your mixes, radio shows, and other endeavours, but be an active part of community too by engaging with others in an honest maner.

Our federation block policy is heavily informed by consensus blocklists at oliphant.social with their trusted sources. We take moderation seriously. We do our best to create a safer space for minority groups. See our Code of Conduct below.

This instance is currently run and moderated by luka. Let me know if you have any questions, issues or suggestions, or see inappropriate activity.

This server is run via masto.host, which takes great care of running the low-level sysadmin, backups, and is also an emergency contact. In case of shutting down, we guarantee 3 months warning, so members can transfer to another instance.

You can now contribute to server costs via LiberaPay: liberapay.com/djs.social

Server thumbnail is a digital image by Sylvia Ritter used with permission. See more of her work: shop.sylvia-ritter.com and mastodon.social/@sylvia_ritter.

Our Rules in Just a Few Points

  • this is a safer space, not free-speech maximalist place. this means that we take extra care about all marginalized groups, be it based on gender, race, or disablity. be kind, check your privilege, etc. details below.
  • nazis, racists, TERFs, transphobes edge-lords and similar are not welcome
  • expectation 1: generous use of CW and almost obligatory ALT text (descriptions) to all media (if possible - see also about lived experiences below)
  • expecation 2: local timeline is a communal space which you should take care of well. therefore make sure you think well before you post public, and use unlisted as default.
  • we defederate pre-emptively, and a lot.

djs.social Rules and Etiquette

We want everyone to have a great time, feel welcome and to let cool ideas flow around. Giving everyone some guidelines helps you all to know what's up and how we can keep this place an enjoyable, fun and interesting place to be.

There's two parts:

  • Rules: Things that are probably obvious to most people that are hurtful or unpleasant.
  • Etiquette: Things you might not be aware of that help keep the space awesome for everyone.

Rules

This section covers stuff that is not okay to do here - generally because one way or another, it hurts or represses people.

These may not cover every situation, so moderators can still make decisions at their own discretion.

These apply to this instance and elsewhere on other instances, other social networks and IRL.

Your moderators will take any accusations seriously, and will handle them anonymously.

Groups of people that aren't welcome here

If you have the following or similar kinds of ideologies or affiliations, you are not welcome here and you will be immediately banned if found out:

  • Neo-fascism (White supremacy / White nationalism / Neo-nazi / Alt-right / Alt-light / Identitarian / Male supremacy / Manosphere)
  • Reactionary (GamerGate / Anti-feminism / Neo-reactionary)
  • Neo-feudalism ('Anarcho'-capitalism / 'Objectivism' / Right-wing Libertarians)
  • TERF, SWERF or otherwise anti-trans or anti-sex worker
  • Truscum, Transmed or other kinds of identity policing.
  • People who are generally phobic/shitty towards non-binary genders.
  • Religious fundamentalism or anti-abortion. (Other types of religion are A-OK!)
  • Militarism, Chauvinism, Ethno-nationalism, Xenophobia or similar.
  • Stalinism, Maoism or similar. (Non-authoritarian forms of Socialism and Communism are A-OK!)
  • Shitty furries (Nazifurs and any furry that thinks being a bigoted piece of shit is okay!)

If you work in any capacity (whether as a direct employee or a contractor) for any of the following types of organisations, you aren't welcome here, and if you reveal yourself as such, you will be banned:

  • Police
  • Immigration enforcement
  • Intelligence/spy organisations

(This does not mean we will refuse legally valid requests for information, it just means that aside from this type of situation, you are not welcome here in any way.)

Apart from those listed, if you have any ideology that believes in - whether violently, non-violently or religiously - the repression of people based on race, gender identity, sexuality and so on, you are also not welcome here.

Ideologies or affiliations based on controlled counter-violence in opposition to oppression (like antifa/antifascism) are welcome here.

Actions and behaviours that aren't welcome here

This covers a lot of mostly obviously unpleasant stuff.

Hate speech

Hate speech results in an immediate ban. Here are some examples of what we mean:

Comments, imagery, memes or publications that demean, dehumanise, malign or otherwise hurt a person or a group of people based on certain characteristics or group status, including but not limited to:

  • Race
  • Sexuality
  • Gender identity, including trans and non-binary gender identities
  • Age
  • Body size/weight
  • Disability
  • Religion
  • Sex work
  • Kinks or fetishes
  • Certain personas or forms of identity (furries, otherkin, plural systems, etc.)
  • Poverty/lack of wealth

Saying things or things in a particular way, like:

  • Racial slurs, ableist slurs, etc.
  • Intentional misgendering (intentionally using pronouns or phrasing to refer to someone's gender incorrectly)

It's okay to criticise things like religions, but only as long as that isn't just a wedge/shield for bigotry (eg. using feminist concepts to malign all forms of Islam instead of rationally talking about the specific forms of Islam or Islamic communities which do have mysogyny issues).

Marginalised communities (like PoC or women) being fed up with systemic problems and complaining about certain groups' lack of understanding or action about certain issues (ie. white people, men) is not hate speech. If you're not a part of the problem, you don't need to see it as an attack. :)

Generally unacceptable behaviour

These result in an immediate ban:

  • Clearly being disrespectful or acting like an asshole.
  • Telling someone to or suggesting that someone should commit suicide, be killed, or die. (even jokingly)
  • Refusing to CW content that should be in a CW (see the Etiquette section), or refusing moderator requests to CW content.
  • Advertising or preaching (promoting your own work is fine; being paid to shill/advertise for someone else is not fine)
  • Making sex jokes or flirting with someone when they haven't specifically said that's okay on their profile.

Harassment and Threats

Any of these kinds of things will result in an immediate ban:

  • Intentionally sending posts to someone that are designed to distress or insult them.
  • Using posts, screenshots or out of context quotes to mock or make fun of someone else.
  • Submitting false reports against someone else.
  • Continuing to interact with someone after they have told you to stop.
  • Threatening to harrass, threatening to dox, threatening to DDoS, or any other kind of threat.
  • Sexual harassment or acting in a sexually predatory way.

Conspiracy theories, pseudoscience and scams

It's important that our server is a place for constructive ideas, and not ones that are used as weapons, tools of disinformation, or spreading information that can cause harm.

Some kinds of conspiracy talk and discussions of the occult and woo are fine, but these are examples of the kinds of things that are unacceptable here:

  • Anti-vaxxer
  • COVID denial/doomerism: ideologies normalizing the spread of COVID, rejecting risk mitigation such as masking and testing, etc.
  • Climate change denial
  • Flat earthers
  • NWO, Illuminati, Chemtrails, Pizzagate, etc.
  • Hate group conspiracy theories like Holocaust Denial.
  • Pseudoscience like Homeopathy, 'healing crystals', etc.
  • 'Creation Science' and other religious forms of pseudoscience.
  • Promoting MLMs (Multi-Level Marketing schemes) or Ponzi schemes.
  • Promoting, supporting, or using this instance to do business with cryptocurrency, NFTs, play-to-earn gaming, or the like. (Anti-cryptocurrency posting is permitted.)

Guerilla ontologies and similar things are absolutely fine.

Sexual content involving minors

Do not flirt with someone who is under 18.

Do not post illustrated imagery featuring sexualised depictions of people who appear to be underage. Even if there's something saying they are over 18, they should reasonably look like they are over 18.

Do not post erotica involving minors.

Child porn is absolutely not allowed.

Any of these will result in an immediate ban.

Etiquette

These are general things to be aware of if you use our instance. You may not be used to them, and that's okay! We're willing to help you if you stumble along the way.

If a moderator asks you to repost something with a CW or asks you to change or delete a post for a particular reason outlined in this section, it doesn't mean you're in trouble. You're just being given a friendly pointer so you can help make this space awesome for everyone 😄.

Local Timeline

(Mastodon has different 'timelines' that different people can see - the Local Timeline is a timeline everyone in this instance can see. You post to it by choosing 'Public' (the globe icon) in your post toolbar.)

We really want our Local Timeline to be an antidote to traditional social media posting; a more down to earth place where people talk about themselves and what they're up to.

  • Let everyone have space to share things. Be selective about your Local posts and avoid posting too many things at once.
  • Avoid posting lots of external links on the local timeline. We want everyone to share things about themselves, and reposting stuff from elsewhere can make the space feel impersonal.

Use CWs for sensitive content.

CWs (Content Warnings or Content Wrappers) are a really cool way for people to keep climate control over their Mastodon browsing experience. It's especially useful in these stressful times, but it's also useful if you or other people have particular mental health conditions or are just having a bad day.

You should CW a post when it contains any of the following topics, whether the content is good or bad. Feel free to add (+) for positive content, (~) for mixed content and (-) for negative content.

  • Political current events such as elections and government actions (normally abbreviated to 'pol' along with the country/region, ie. 'UKpol', 'DEpol', etc.)
  • Potentially triggering Mental Health topics (normally abbreviated to 'mh'). Many of our members come here to discuss their mental health journey, and we seek to be as welcoming and open as possible, but for the sake of other users: please CW references to self harm, suicide, helplessness and other moods and behaviours that may be contagious or trigger people in recovery
  • Alcohol ('alc') and drugs
  • Diet talk or weight loss Discussion of dieting, including any judgments about "healthy food" even if you're not counting calories, should be CW'd differently from "ooh yummy" types of food posts.
  • Food in general
  • Sexual themes or content
  • Violent themes or content, blood and gore
  • Themes or content about abuse
  • Common phobias (Like certain animals such as snakes and insects.)
  • Long posts or posts with multiple parts (please also use the 'unlisted' privacy setting for posts after the first in a thread, so that the local timeline doesn't get flooded)

Also CW images that have nudity or these areas of the body exposed:

  • A certain area around the nipples (and/or the nipples themselves). From the end of the ribcage to the bust line.
  • Anything less than what boxer briefs or shorts would cover around the groin area.

This applies to all bodies regardless of gender.

We don't want to ask anyone to CW their identities. We particularly don't want to ask marginalized people to CW their marginalization. We're not going to be hardline about the rules in cases where there are compelling reasons to frame what you're saying differently...

...but "this is important, so I won't CW" and "this is urgent, so I won't CW" are non-sequiturs - the importance and the urgency have nothing to do with whether that content is more accessible with a content warning.

Always write descriptions for your images.

Mastodon has an image description feature, meaning that you can attach text descriptions to the images you upload so the blind or visually impaired can understand what the image is.

There is never a time that this would not be potentially useful to someone.

Some tips for writing image descriptions:

Write:

  • Placement of objects
  • The kind of image it is (photo, painting, drawing, CG, chart, text, screenshot etc.)
  • Colours
  • People and animals
  • Placement of text
  • Emotions (ie. smiling)
  • General surroundings)
  • (Generally what is important to understanding the picture, or what the point of the picture is.)

Don't write:

  • Descriptions that are too detailed.
  • Details of the picture that would be obvious in the given context (like, you don't need to say that a face has two eyes, a nose and a mouth because you've said it's a face).
  • Details that aren't the point or the focus of the picture.
  • (Generally what isn't important to understanding the picture, or what the point of the picture is.)

Unfortunately, not all mobile apps do image descriptions, but just try your best!

Be explicit about region-specific posts.

Keep in mind that Mastodon has users from all over the world.

If you have a post (like advice or politics) that's only relevant to a certain part of the world, mention what part of the world it is for.

Avoid subtooting when you can.

Subtooting (like subtweeting) is talking about something someone else has said without talking to the person who said it directly.

This is a tempting thing to do (and sometimes an ideal thing to do) if you don't want to get into a particular situation, but it has a negative side effect if you're not careful. It can make the entire environment hostile because subtooting can make people unsure whether you might be talking about them or not.

Be careful when considering giving unsolicited advice.

We try to be respectful of the opinions and views of others. Often unsolicited advice or prosletyzing, while well intentioned, can never the less make a person feel like their beliefs, values, or experience are invalid. For this reason, you should err on the side of caution.

If you see something bad, tell your moderator(s).

Corporate social media like Twitter and Tumblr can often make people feel powerless to actually take people who behave badly out of the picture, and this can lead to an ecosystem where issues are taken out publicly, and they can create mobs that cause a lot of people stress and can also easily harm the wrong people.

Here, you have moderators who are willing and able to help you and investigate and deal with problems. Please don't post publicly about these issues, make a report or DM one of your local moderators.

Leave edgy humour and societal baggage at the door.

There are things you might be used to doing that you think are okay, but they actually hurt other people or make them feel unwelcome.

You'll need to keep in mind that these are not okay and you shouldn't do these kinds of things if you decide to make an account here.

Here are some examples:

  • Rape jokes
  • Making jokes at the expense of content warnings ('triggered' jokes).
  • Putting marginalised people in the position of having to defend or explain their marginalisation. It's your responsibility to do your own research.
  • Microaggressions (you can find some examples of what that kind of thing is here)
  • Using phrases similar to 'not all men...' when someone is just venting about something they've experienced. If you're not a part of the problem, then you don't need to see it as a personal attack.
  • Not using CWs properly (see the CW section above for guidance).

We'll help you if you genuinely make mistakes along the way, but please really try to keep them in mind.

Credits

These Rules and Etiquette are originally by weirder.earth, licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License. Consequently, these are also available under same conditions.

We're a gaming community that's been floating around on the internet since 2003. Some of us like games.

Started this up as a bit of an experiment, but people use it, so here we are. Feel free to join, we're generally friendly.

We don't sell your information

As far as we're concerned your personal information is yours, we don't sell it or pass it to 3rd parties.

We don't push ads, nor will we. We don't ask for donations as at present the costs of us offering this aren't worth it and we're more than happy to cover the hosting costs to further promote a decentralised open web.

Information about Mastodon apps

If a Mastodon app requests a server for login, that should be entered as mstdn.gamercast.net.

Other amazing things run on gamercast.net like our website, which is why that typically won't work. 🙂

Security

This server scores A+ on Mozilla Observatory and A+ on cryptcheck.fr.

We highly recommend setting up 2FA in your account settings under Account -> Account settings -> Two-factor Auth when using the web interface.

Moderation Team

Please reach out to the moderation team if you have any problems.

  • @RoofusLukas
  • @Paul

Server information

The server is based in Colo-X's Interxion LON 1 datacentre in London, UK.

Not sure which server to join? Not sure what community should be part of your identity? Join undefined.social and leave the answers to these questions undefined.

Server Details

This server will always run the latest version of Mastodon. It is set up with scaling and redundancy in mind.

If you're interested in analytics for your Mastodon account I also run a free and open source analytics service.

If you really like undefined.social feel free to buy me a coffee.

Why?

There are several reasons why this server was created, primarily because of speed, reliability, and curiosity:

1> I am having fun; installing the server and exploring the technology is just something I love doing.

2> I am ensuring that I have the options instead of delegating those options to some stranger on the Internet.

Speed

First, unlike Twitter, most Mastodon instances are operated by individuals, volunteers running the server application on hardware they own (or at a cloud service they hire). While hosting a Mastodon party may sound like a fun proposition, it attracts many people to these open servers. Most users need to realize that no big company is paying the bills and putting in the work to maintain and update the software; they grew up on Facebook and Twitter, so the thought does not even cross their minds. More users mean more computer resources. Every system has its limits, and speed, or lack thereof, is the first thing you notice missing on popular servers.

I like the services I use to be fast, something significant company-backed propositions like Twitter and Facebook have no problem delivering. However, speed is not guaranteed in the Mastodon federation realm of servers, so I am hosting my server with the hardware it needs to be performant.

Reliability

Some of these servers may vanish at any moment in time. Some may grow beyond the ability to administrate the Linux platform and keep fresh backups on hand, or the owner may eventually be unable or unwilling to pay for hardware and electricity bills.

Should you join my server https://mrnet.pt? Unless you are not bothered to have your account data lost and committed to a DNS domain I own (for as long as I keep paying for it), the answer should be "no". I have no idea if I will want to keep this server for a few days or a lifetime. However, if you want to see how Mastodon works, with no pre-conceived expectations on how long you will be able to use this server of mine, just testing the waters... let me know, and I'll send you an invite.

Sounds like a precarious investment of your time in social media?

The bad news is that the same goes for every other Mastodon server out there! Unlike big-tech-based social media sites, we are talking about volunteers, private individuals footing the bills and their own time. Make of it what you want, but I needed to ensure the fate of my Mastodon account was in my hands.

If you decide to join my Mastodon instance, let me tell you that I may take it down to use the computer for a few hours for something else. See, my hardware, my electricity, no commitment to your needs. If you're okay with "it will be available to you when it's available to me" then great, have fun.

Curiosity

I am a geek. I like technology. Looking at the Mastodon server side of things is fun for me. Yes, it will be a pain to maintain over time, there will be downtime episodes, and none of that bothers me. But, quite the opposite, it looks like a great hobby for those rainy days.

I dislike Ruby on rails with a passion. The masochist in me just decided to do it.


More about the server

The server is hosted in Portugal (EU).

You can read all about the hardware, backups, security, etc, here

info.full_description:
<h2>What's Mastodon?</h2>
    <p>
        Traditional social media relies on selling your data to advertisers. Mastodon is different. 
        It is diverse ecosystem consisting of multiple servers hosting user profiles which are connected to each other.
        Like email, you can choose your provider and even switch it from the settings later on if you wish. 
        If you aren't happy with any provider, you can even install your own server and set your own rules. 
        Mastodon lets you control your data!
    </p>
<h2>How's jako.social different from other Mastodon instances?</h2>
<p>
    Traditional social media makes money by forcing users to give up their data if they want 
    to access that platform and they often rely on that. Mastodon tries to be different, but 
    without ad revenue, how can an instance survive? Most instances pay their server bills 
    using donations which they depend on. This makes it almost impossible to be sure which instance
    will receive enough donations to keep it alive for the next year.
</p>
<p>
    Jako.social is funded using web monetization protocol, which aims to be more sustainable than just
    donations, so the hosting bill is paid by our users and backed up by @jimbo@jako.social. Therefore there is
    no pressure for data collection or advertising, since there are no shareholders or no reason to make this profitable,
    the main goal is just to get enough income to keep the servers running. No more or no less. If there ever happened 
    to be more income than needed, it  will be donated towards the development of Mastodon or Pixelfed.
</p>
<p>
    Using web monetization on Jako.social is optional.
</p>
<h3>What's web monetization?</h3>
<p>
    Web monetization is a way to fund websites without collecting
    excessive amounts of user data. In practice it requires just a browser extension, which sends tiny
    fractions per second of chosen currency to any website which is currently active, on some websites, you may get ad free experience
    other premium features. At the time of writing, the expenses are limited to 5$/month/user and there are no other expenses for the user
    on Coil.com which is the creator of this protocol.
</p>
<p>
    Web monetization is different from direct donation, since with web monetization the website you spend the 
    most time on will get the highest split of the monthly five dollars, and you as the user will receive the 
    benefits on every web monetization enabled website. On Jako.social, we consider it as a donation, but 
    instead of fixed donation amount, we have to "earn" the donation by providing reliable service, web monetization
    only works when the website is working.
</p>
<p>
    But as mentioned earlier, using this is optional. However to our knowledge this is the only
    Mastodon instance supporting web monetization at the moment if you happen to already be web monetization user.
</p>
<a href="https://coil.com/" target="_blank"><button>Read more about web monetization from Coil.com</button></a>

<p>
    The web monetization is implemented using NGINX 
    injection to the html so no source code is modified and no scripts are added.
</p>

<h3>Who is this server for?</h3>
<p>
    This server is't focused into any specific topic
</p>

<h2>Code of Conduct</h2>

More details can available by clicking the list items.

<ul>
    <li>
        <details>
            <summary>The content posted on this server must comply with Finnish law!</summary>
            <ul>
                <li>Our moderators are humans and we rather be safe than sorry when it comes to edge cases related to law</li>
                <li>Selling or marketing of drugs or teaching how to make them may result in moderation actions like limitations even if the content is legal in Finland for safety reasons</li>
                <li>Selling or marketing of weapons or teaching how to make them is prohibited</li>
            </ul>
        </details>
    </li>
    <li>
        <details>
            <summary>No spamming or mass advertising</summary>
            <ul>
                <li>
                    Please contact admins before setting up a bot
                </li>
    <li>
        Profiles belonging to different entities (like corporations, organizations) with no content and no profile picture and profiles with primarily advertisements will be silenced or shut down per case basis. Jako.social isn't a place to primarily boost your Search Engine Optimization (SEO).
    </li>
            </ul>
        </details>
    </li>
    <li>
        <details>
            <summary>No harrassing of other users</summary>
            <ul>
                <li>Posting (or threatening to post) other people's personally identifying information without permission is prohibited</li>
            </ul>
        </details> 
    </li>
    <li>
        No pornography, no sexual depictions of children
    </li>
    <li>
        <details><summary> No promotion of conspiracy theories or organized spreading 
        of misinformation</summary>
        This includes theories that undermine public health
        </details>
    </li>
    <li>
        No Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities or minorities in general, or advocation thereof
    </li>
    <li>
        No xenophobic and/or violent nationalism
    </li>
    <li>
        No Holocaust denialism, no Nazi symbolism, no promotion of 
        National Socialism
    </li>
    <li>
        No gore or graphic violence
    </li>
    <li>
        Please use the content warning option when necessary. 
        Content warning is not a way to circumvent the rules for behavior
    </li>
</ul>
<p>
    These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service 
    reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at 
    any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.
</p>
<p>
    Mastodon allows you to view and interact with content from
    other servers, which we cannot moderate.
</p>
<h3>Who is behind this server</h3>
<p>
    <a href="https://jako.social/@jimbo" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">@jimbo</a>
</p>

Hauptrichtlinie ¶

Unsere Hauptrichtlinie: → "Seid nett zueinander!"

Rules ¶

"Be excellent to each other" is easier said than done, and means different things to different people.

The following rules are a (non-exhaustive) list of behaviours that may lead to deletion of toots, silencing or suspension of accounts, at the descretion of the instance administrators, as described in our Terms.

Please report behaviour that bothers you. We will keep your report confidential.

  • We do not tolerate discriminatory behaviour and content promoting or advocating the oppression of members of marginalised groups. These groups may be characterised by any of the following (though this list is naturally incomplete):
    • ethnicity
    • gender identity or expression
    • sexual identity or expression
    • physical characteristics or age
    • disability or illness
    • nationality, residency, citizen status
    • wealth or education
    • religious affiliation, agnosticism or atheism
  • We do not tolerate threatening behaviour, stalking, and doxxing.
  • We do not tolerate harassment, including brigading, dogpiling, or any other form of contact with a user who has stated that they do not wish to be contacted.
  • We do not tolerate mobbing, including name-calling, intentional misgendering or deadnaming.
  • We do not tolerate violent nationalist propaganda, Nazi symbolism or promoting the ideology of National Socialism.
  • We do not tolerate conspiracy narratives or other reactionary myths supporting or leading to the above-mentioned (and/or similar) behavior.
  • Actions intended to damage this instance or its performance may lead to immediate account suspension.
  • Content that is illegal in Germany will be deleted and may lead to immediate account suspension.


Best practices ¶

The list below is a collection of behaviour that we expect to see from our users. If you see a user go against these best practices in a way that bothers you, please file a report and we will talk to them. While these best practices are designed to be guidelines for a good communal instance, repeated malicious unwillingness to follow the best practices will be considered just like breaking a rule.

  • In general, use the tools provided to foster a considerate and accessible atmosphere. This includes the liberal use of content warnings (especially on potentially disturbing or controversial topics), and alt-text captioning of media files.
  • When possible, provide credit for creative works in your posts that are not your own.
  • Uninvited comments about another user's personal choices, lifestyle or family are strongly discouraged and may be considered harassment. Inappropriate sexual attention, comments about appearance and implication of physical contact will not be tolerated toward any non-consenting user.
  • If you post sexual content or gore, use content warnings.
  • If you post advertisements, use a content warning. Advertisements should not be excessive or automated.
  • Bots may only interact with a user when they're invited by that user to do so.
  • Automated posts and high-frequency posts should be unlisted (rendering visible to everybody, but not appearing on the local timeline) to keep the local timeline of our instance a place of community dialogue and human interaction. This extends to bots, feed posters, Twitter "retweets" and Twitter crossposts with broken mentions. Crossposter accounts that stop being active participants in our community may be removed at the discretion of the moderators.
  • In discussions, please remain civil, do not insult the people you're talking to. Note that irony, sarcasm, or similar modes of language don't translate well to written language and tend to escalate discussions or misunderstandings.

(These best practices were inspired by the Terms of bsd.network. Thank you!)

We (@watchdog and @Jens) are maintaining this instance on our spare time, hardware and nerves. Don't push either of those.

Welcome to The Global Public Square

An open community that welcomes all folks who follow the rules and need a safe place in the Fediverse.

We are also committed to the Mastodon Covenant¹.

Our Mission

Mastodon and the wider Fediverse is decentralized: it isn't owned by anyone or any entity, but is comprised of many instances (servers) owned and operated by many diverse folks throughout the world.

We believe communication is an inalienable human right and in the modern age, most people communicate online.

Our organization is committed to ensuring an open and safe space for all.

Special Account Classifications

Corporate and Brand accounts

Most servers do not allow accounts for these types of accounts. We however do see some value in having these accounts. Some companies provide value in their posts and aren't always trying to sell all of the time.

We ask that you do not be spammy and make sure your posts are designed for folks to engage with you and for you to engage with the people.

The exception for engagement is for accounts that belong to companies that provide automatic status updates on their services. For example, a cloud company is having an outage and they are letting their customers know.

Bots

We also allow bots on this instance as long as they are marked as bots.

NSFW/18+ Accounts

Accounts that primarily posts content for a mature audience must use content warning settings in all posts.

If it's illegal in the United States, it's not allowed here.

Donations

This server is currently privately funded by @elan@publicsquare.global and run by volunteer efforts.

Servers, storage, bandwidth are all expensive and donations are welcomed and appreciated.

You may do so here: https://ko-fi.com/elanhasson.

¹ While committed to the Mastodon Covenant, we meet all criteria except for item 3, which is "At least one other person with emergency access to the server infrastructure",this will change soon and we will be FULLY compliant.

info.full_description:
ORFodon

ORFodon stellt die Nachrichten von ORF.at mittels Mastodon im Fediverse bereit. Hierbei handelt es sich um ein privates, nicht-kommerzielles Projekt von @cymaphore@i.cymaphore.net

Auf dieser Seite werden die Profile, verfügbare Funktionen, Filter sowie die Funktionsweise der Plattform beschrieben.

Ohne jede Gewähr

Alle ORF-Grafiken und -Inhalte sind Copyright des Österreichischen Rundfunk (ORF). Die Beiträge werden technisch aufbereitet, aber bleiben inhaltlich unverändert.

Allgemeines zur Nutzung

Alle Beiträge sind öffentlich und ohne Anmeldung zugänglich, siehe Live-Feed.

Um den Nachrichten folgen zu können, wird ein Profil im Fediverse, etwa auf einem beliebigen Mastodon-Server, benötigt. Einige dieser Server, zum Beispiel wien.rocks, fedi.at, graz.social, aut.social, tyrol.social, troet.fediverse.at, social.moment.at und mastodon.wien werden in bzw. für Österreich betrieben.

Die Entdecken-Seite der Instanz zeigt die aktuell populärsten ORF-Nachrichten und meistgenutzten Nachrichten-Hashtags.

Profile und Sparten

Die vollständige Liste der Profile (Nachrichtenkanäle) kann jederzeit im Profilverzeichnis eingesehen werden.

Allgemein

  • @ORF_News: Primärer Newsticker mit den wichtigsten Nachrichten aus allen Sparten und den Bundesländern

Alternative Filter-Profile

  • @ORF_News_LitePlus: Beiträge aus @ORF_News inklusive den wichtigsten Bundesländer-Nachrichten; ohne Help, Religion, Science und Sport
  • @ORF_News_Lite: Beiträge aus @ORF_News komplett ohne Help, Religion, Science, Sport und den Bundesländer-Nachrichten

Gefiltert wird anhand der Unteradresse (wien.ORF.at, sport.ORF.at, ...). Die wenigen direkt im Newsticker veröffentlichten Spartenthemen passieren den Filter daher.

Wichtig: Diese Filter-Profile dienen als Alternative zu @ORF_News. Es sollte daher nur einem von diesen drei Profilen auf einmal gefolgt werden, da die Filterung ansonsten nicht wirkt.

Anschließend kann man sich einzelne Sparten (Science, Religion, ...) und Bundesländer individuell dazu holen.

Sparten

  • @ORF_Help: Ratgeber und Beiträge zur Hilfestellung
  • @ORF_Religion: Religionsnachrichten
  • @ORF_Science: Wissenschaftsnachrichten
  • @ORF_Sport: Sportnachrichten

Da @ORF_News nur einen Teil der Nachrichten der Sparten übernimmt, kann es sich bei Interesse lohnen, einem oder mehrer dieser Profile zusätzlich zu folgen.

Bundesländer

  • @ORF_Oesterreich: Bundesländer, boostet die Beiträge der Bundesländer, gelegentlich eigene Beiträge
  • @ORF_Burgenland: Nachrichten aus dem Burgenland
  • @ORF_Kaernten: Nachrichten aus Kärnten
  • @ORF_Niederoesterreich: Nachrichten aus Niederösterreich
  • @ORF_Oberoesterreich: Nachrichten aus Oberösterreich
  • @ORF_Salzburg: Nachrichten aus Salzburg
  • @ORF_Steiermark: Nachrichten aus der Steiermark
  • @ORF_Tirol: Nachrichten aus Tirol
  • @ORF_Vorarlberg: Nachrichten aus Vorarlberg
  • @ORF_Wien: Nachrichten aus Wien

Da @ORF_News nur einen kleinen Teil der Nachrichten der Bundesländer übernimmt, kann es sich bei Interesse lohnen, einem oder mehrer dieser Profile zusätzlich zu folgen.

Nachrichten selektieren und filtern

Der ORF stellt die Nachrichten in sehr gut strukturierter Form bereit. Da das Nachrichtenaufkommen sehr hoch ist, wurden hier für Mastodon einige Maßnahmen ergriffen, um eine bessere Filterung zu ermöglichen.

Um die Selektion zu vereinfachen gibt es für @ORF_News zwei Filter-Profile, @ORF_News_LitePlus und @ORF_News_Lite. Diese enthalten keine Sparten, "Plus" enthält noch die wichtigsten Bundesländer-Nachrichten.

Ebenfalls ist es möglich, @ORF_News ohne geteilte Beiträge zu folgen, um nur die relevantesten Nachrichten zu erhalten.

Selektiv kann man dann je nach Wunsch weiteren Profilen folgen, um sich seine persönliche Nachrichtenauswahl zusammen zu stellen.

Die Beiträge erhalten am Ende außerdem kategoriespezifische und automatisch ermittelte Hashtags, die zu einer weiteren Filterung herangezogen werden können.

Weitere Details können den üblichen Mastodon-Dokumentation und Tutorials zum Thema Liste, Filter und Hashtags entnommen werden.

Beispiele

Ich will die normalen Nachrichten und alles aus Wien und Niederösterreich

Folge @ORF_News, @ORF_Wien und @ORF_Niederoesterreich

Ich will die normalen Nachrichten

Folge @ORF_News

Ich will die wichtigsten Nachrichten, alles aus Science und den Ratgeber - aber kein Religion und keinen Sport

Folge @ORF_News_LitePlus, @ORF_Science, @ORF_Help

Ich will neben den normalen Nachrichten auch alles aus Science

Folge @ORF_News und @ORF_Science

Ich will die normalen Nachrichten, aber der Sport muss weg

Folge @ORF_News und schalte @ORF_Sport stumm

Ich will den normalen Nachrichten und ALLE Sportnachrichten

Folge @ORF_News und @ORF_Sport

Ich will die normalen Nachrichten und komplett alle Nachrichten aus den Bundesländern, aber keine Sparten

Folge @ORF_News_Lite und @ORF_Oesterreich

Hashtags

Im Fediverse kommt Hashtags, also mit dem Raute-Symbol markierten Worten, eine besondere Bedeutung zu. Dementsprechend werden die Nachrichten automatisiert anhand einer willkürlich gepflegten Liste wichtiger Begriffe (in Github einsehbar) mit zusätzlichen Hashtags versehen.

Diese können dann unter anderem direkt zur Suche nach weiteren Beiträgen verwendet werden, z.B.: #_Feuerwehr, #_WKStA, #_Wolf, #_IT, #_FußballBLG, #_Europawahl, #_Wien, #_Klimaschutz, #_Deutschland, ...

Warum haben die Hashtags einen Unterstrich am Anfang (#_Beispiel)?

Das Fediverse ist ein soziales Netzwerk von Menschen für Menschen. Die Beiträge bei ORFodon werden automatisiert erstellt und kommen in hoher Frequenz.

Hierdurch wurden in der Vergangenheit viele normale Hashtags (z.B. #Wien) mit Nachrichten regelrecht überflutet und die Beiträge echter Menschen verdrängt. Um den echten Benutzern "Vorrang" zu geben ohne die Vorteile von Hashtags zu verlieren, wurde diese Lösung gewählt und die Hashtag-Generierung entsprechend geändert.

Das hat Nachteiile bei der Auffindbarkeit, Reichweite und Sichtbarkeit, aber es ist Rücksichtsvoller gegenüber der Allgemeinheit.

Funktionsweise

Ein Service-Script holt in regelmäßigen Abständen die RSS-Feeds des ORF ab und bereitet diese auf. Hierbei werden Hashtags generiert und die Beiträge den jeweiligen Profilen zugeordnet. Üblicherweise werden Nachrichten spätestens eine Minute nach der Veröffentlichung hier gepostet.

Das Service-Script kann auf GitHub eingesehen werden: github.com/Cymaphore/orfodon-service

Ist ein Beitrag ein Verweis auf eine andere Sparte (z.B. im Newsticker ein Beitrag aus Wien), dann wird der Beitrag nicht doppelt angelegt, sondern stattdessen geteilt. Erscheint eine Nachricht erneut im gleichen Feed, teilt das Profil die bestehende Nachricht von sich selbst.

Zum Anhängen von zusätzlichen Hashtags wird eine willkürliche Liste relevanter Begriffe gepflegt. Sollte es hiermit Probleme geben, bitte den Service-Account anschreiben. Hashtags werden mit einem Prefix ("_") versehen.

Der Service verwendet bevorzugt den Detailtext für die Beiträge. Ist dieser nicht verfügbar, wird der Titel verwendet. Bei Ticker-Meldungen versucht das Script, den Detailtext von der Website auszulesen. Beiträge sind auf 500 Zeichen begrenzt.

x1_gw

Die Aufteilung der Nachrichten auf einzelne Profile hat die Filterbarkeit von Nachrichten verbessert, aber auch negative Auswirkungen auf die Auffindbarkeit der Profile und Nachrichten.

Um diesem Problem entgegen zu wirken, wurde auf mehreren besonders relevanten Instanzen ein Profil mit dem Namen "x1_gw" angelegt. Dieses folgt den Nachrichtenprofilen und sorgt dafür, dass diese sauber föderiert werden und somit ohne Umweg auffindbar sind.

Da diese Profile auf absehbare Zeit keinen weiteren Zweck erfüllen, sind sie als automatisiert markiert und mit einem markaten Profilsymbol versehen.

Code of Conduct

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of fellies.social; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies

The following types of content may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:

  • Racism or advocation of racism
  • Sexism or advocation of sexism
  • Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
  • Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism

    • The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:

  • Sexual depictions of children
  • Content illegal in Germany, such as holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism
  • Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism
  • Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:
  • Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
  • Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
  • Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.
  • These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

A digital tree in a federated garden. A calm, welcoming place to talk about whatever, but especially interested in technology, music, and films/TV.

What do I do here? Orchard is a Mastodon instance. Mastodon is a federated platform for microblogging.

What's federation? Federation refers to the platform's ability to communicate with other servers and platforms through a shared protocol, in this case ActivityPub. Basically, imagine a world where all of your social media apps were interconnected, and you could get content on your platform from a different one.

What tools do I have to protect myself from harassment? We want to make Orchard feel like a safe place to be. At least, relatively safe, in a social media context. If someone slips past Orchard's moderation, you have a range of tools to combat trolls and harassment on the platform. To stop seeing posts from someone, you have the ability to filter them, mute them, or block them completely. To limit the ability for you to be targeted, you have the options of opting out of discovery, hiding your social graph, or making your profile private. For each post, you can also change the visibility. You're also encouraged to report any bad actors to us.

😀 Fediverse Friendly Moderation Covenant

This instance commits to the following

1. Administration and Moderation will be handled as neutral as possible

Reports and widespread information on specific instances (often known as bad actors) will be verified and actions might be taken as necessary.

2. Actions taken will respond to the bare minimum to keep the network operating and not influence the ability of the instances users to connect to other people

  • If another instance spreads media content of questionable legality for the region the current instance is operating from, these files might be rejected from being saved.
  • If another instance is sharing hateful messages that impact local users, there might be consideration of silencing that specific instance from being visible in timelines. If users follow and/or wish to follow users on the target instance, they are still free to do so.
  • If another instance is posting content illegal in the local instance operation region or actively posts content attacking local users, a full instance block might be the last resort.

3. Communication before Actions

If any of the above behaviours start to surface from a given instance, the moderation of the local instance will attempt to inform the moderation/administration of that instance and resolve the problems coming from there. Only if no communication succeeded or no results that resolved issues came forth, actions will be taken towards that instance.

4. We won't recommend blocks

Blocklists and block recommendations as an information source are taken for granted but lack accurate verification. Instead of using these options to publicly announce instances of questionable intent, we will inform local users of such, with the reminder of possible personal options for hiding content that might impact their experience of the network.

5. No Guilt-by-Association/Federation

If we have applied any action against Instance X, an Instance Y that federates with them will not get the same judgement applied to them. A natural connection, as by the networks design, does not imply shared interests and thus doesn't warrant the same moderation methods.

Regardless of all given points above, in special cases the instance moderation/administration might still opt to block an instance, while this is tried to be avoided at most.

This Covenant is based on The Fediverse-Friendly Moderation Covenant and is licensed under CC0

PerfumeFan.jp について

運営目的

本サービスは、主に日本居住者もしくは日本語話者による、テクノポップユニット「Perfume」が好きな人たちが集うマストドンサーバーです。 Perfumeが好きな人たちの交流の場として開設しました。Perfumeを好きであれば、どなたでもご登録できます。

ルール

1. 本マストドンサーバーは、テクノポップユニット「Perfume」を好きな人たちの交流の場です。登録条件は「Perfumeが好きであること」です。

「Perfumeが好き」であれば、基本的にどなたでも登録、利用いただけます。「『ポリリズム』が好き」「『チョコレイト・ディスコ』だけは好き」「『FLASH』いいよね！」「曲はよくしらないけど雰囲気が好き」「なんか好き」レベルで構いません。好きの深浅、ファン歴、ライブの参加回数等は関係なし。「Perfume好き」に優劣、貴賤はありません。

2. 参加者間の交流の妨げとなる行為（営利活動、攻撃的言動、誹謗中傷、強要、扇動、勧誘等）を禁じます。

交流の場ですので、「営利活動」「他人に対する攻撃的言動」「誹謗中傷」「行動/言動の強要」「他者の扇動を目的とした言動」「思想、信教、営利活動への勧誘」等の、参加者同士の交流の妨げとなるような行為は一切禁止します。

info.full_description:
Welcome to Puppo Space!

About this Instance


Puppo Space is a general, furry-orientated instance that promotes openness and a supportive environment for people from different walks of life. Users are encouraged to engage in friendly discussions across a broad range of topics without fear of discrimination or targeted harassment of an individual or group. Users are responsible for helping maintain a harassment-free environment by consistently and accurately reporting content that fails to meet these requirements.

Content Management



The Mastodon software implements a feature called Content Warnings (or CWs for short) that can be used to set a message in front of content and hide the rest behind the "Show More" button. If a user does not wish to view the content described in the message simply ignore the "Show More" button.
Content that is not properly hidden behind a suitable CW are subject to removal by the moderation team. Content that originates from outside the Puppo Space instance will be silenced if content does not follow these guidelines. Users can still follow users and receive toots from silenced instances.

Suspended Instances



Instances that go against the mission of this instance, fail to properly moderate content, promote hateful ideology, and generally cause a nuisance on the federation as reported by other Masto-Admins are subject to having their instance suspended from federating with Puppo Space.

Registration Requirements


  • Minimum signup age 18
  • A valid email address

Restricted Content


  • NFSW/Lewd/Adult Content not hidden behind a CW
  • Political commentary or mentions of drugs or drug use without a CW
  • Excessively large messages not contained behind a CW
  • Harassment (of any kind)
  • Content deemed illegal within the United States or Canada
  • Content owned by someone else and used without permission
  • Posts promoting excessive or extremist levels of violence
  • Distribution of malware or other potentially unwanted software through the service
  • Using hurtful or targeted language to attack a certain group or user
  • Excessive trolling
  • Misappropriating memes as use as hate symbols, this includes posting memes that are largely considered to be hate symbols


Intentional Abuse



Use of data transmitted to or from Puppo Space servers in a manor that is not consistent with its expected use is deemed abuse and will result in the offending party(s) access to the services being permanently revoked. Actions considered abuse are not limited to...


  • Stalking a particular user
  • Using posts in order to provide targeted advertising
  • Scraping user profiles (Mastodon bots are okay)
  • Intentionally submitting excessive amounts of posts within a small window of time
  • False reports, intentionally rallying users to mass report a user will also be considered abuse
  • Intentional attempts to mislead or impersonate a specific user or group

Clear notification of boundaries



Users who ignore clear attempts by one or more parties to end further communication on a topic (eg: messages asking to be left alone or to go away) will receive disciplinary actions taken against their account.

Multiple Accounts



Users are permitted to have multiple accounts for use in separating their content (eg: separate SFW and NSFW accounts) or for use in bots. Using multiple accounts as a way to evade a block is not permitted under any circumstances.

Team Invitation



Users who are actively involved in the community and are consistently being positive role models may be invited to join the moderation team. Users who are invited to the moderation team are expected to maintain a professional separation from moderation duties and interactions with other users.
Under no circumstances should a moderator use their powers in a manner deemed inappropriate by the administration team. Moderators who fail to meet these requirements will be promptly removed from the team.

Moderators and Administrators of Puppo Space volunteer their time and effort to keep this website going. Please do not send in applications or requests to join the team if you absolutely require a paycheck for your time and dedication.

Reporting Copyright Infringement



Puppo Space allows users to share messages between local and remote instances and does not employ algorithms in order to detect content posted on the network.

If you are a copyright owner whose intellectual rights have been violated due to a post on Puppo Space, please send details (Offending user, message URL, timestamp) and any supporting documentation verifying ownership of said content to dmca at puppo dot space.

Content found to be in violation of the DMCA are subject to immediate removal and are immediately purged from our edge cache upon deletion. Users who regularly post copyrighted material without permission will be permanently suspended.

Submitting an appeal



If you are an instance owner and have identified your instance in our suspend/silence filter and wish to know more, please contact the instance operators at staff at puppo dot space

If you are a user and believe you have been wrongfully suspended or banned from the instance you are allowed up to a maximum of 5 appeals, after which all further requests for unblock will be ignored.

Intentionally using a proxy or VPN service in order to evade a ban will result in that service's addresses being blocked. If you are caught evading a temporary ban both accounts will be upgraded to a permaban.

Welcome to Techy.social!

We are a community of tech enthusiasts and professionals in the tech industry. We welcome anyone who is interested in tech and looking for a safe space. All we ask is that you be kind and respectful to one another and follow the rules of the server.

Some Ground Rules

TL;DR: Don't be a dick.

We want everyone to have a safe space to have open conversations, share interesting topics, and maybe even help each other out. There will be times when people have heated discussions and that's fine, just no personal attacks. Personal attacks equals crossing the line and we'll politely ask you to leave our server. Please be civil, polite, and respectful.

Moderation

The purpose of moderation is to ensure we have a space where people feel safe and included, and open conversations can be had while not allowing hate speech, toxic behavior, or harassment.

If you get on our radar, we'll reach out to you and start a dialog. We believe in seeking to understand. There's a possibly that expectations haven't been set and we'll work with you to find a happy medium. If the behavior continues, we'll politely ask you to leave our server.

Is the server down?

Bookmark our status page at status.techy.social. Server maintenance typically occurs on the weekends and advanced notice, if possible, will be announced.

Speaking of server, how's this thing held together? (hint: not a Band-Aid)

  • We use Cloudflare to provide CDN, caching, and security
  • Media content is hosted in S3
  • Our servers are US-based and hosted at Hetzner (and not in a basement)
  • We have dedicated servers that do dedicated tasks (app, database, and job processing)
  • Backups are taken nightly with multiple copies of nightly database backups
  • This server with built using industry best practices and keeping the server online will be made with every possible effort (no guarantees and some things are outside of our control)
  • If this server isn't able to continue operation due to lack of funding or other reasons, we'll let you know ASAP with at least 3 months notice to migrate your account to other servers

info.short_description: 紫风铃，它的名字象征着青春和自由的风，铃声回荡在我们的回忆里，唤醒了我们对美好生活的向往。让我们再次共舞于紫风铃之下，享受那份宁静与温馨。欢迎回家，欢迎回到紫风铃！
info.full_description:
紫风铃，是那个曾经我们年轻的时代的见证者。它承载着我们热血的青春和无限的憧憬，是我们共同的回忆和珍藏。在紫风铃论坛上，我们畅所欲言，分享喜悦与忧愁，我们建立了深厚的友谊，找到了志同道合的伙伴。每一个故事、每一次交流都让我们更加坚定地相信，友情和情感是生命中最珍贵的礼物。

然而，随着时间的推移，我们离开了校园，各自踏上不同的人生道路。我们离开了这个特殊的时光隧道。紫风铃的声音逐渐淡去，留下的只有静寂和回忆。我们曾短暂地告别了这个家，离开了彼此的视线。但是现在，我们再次相聚在这里，发现曾经的羁绊依然存在。

岁月如梭，时光荏苒，我们又相聚在紫风铃的怀抱中。我们曾经一起度过的青春岁月仿佛昨日重现，无论你是那个热血沸腾的少年，还是已经经历岁月沉淀的成熟者，如今再次欢迎你回到这个曾经属于我们的地方。在这里，每一个声音都值得被倾听，每一个故事都值得被分享。让我们再次迎接那些美好的时光，与旧日的朋友重逢，与新的伙伴相遇。在这个永远温暖的家园，让我们一同创造更多的回忆，一同续写属于我们的传奇。

紫风铃，它的名字象征着青春和自由的风，铃声回荡在我们的回忆里，唤醒了我们对美好生活的向往。让我们再次共舞于紫风铃之下，享受那份宁静与温馨。

欢迎回家，欢迎回到紫风铃！

info.full_description:
Federation Policy

The Mailbag limits federation with instances dedicated to NSFW content. Members can still interact with and follow people from these instances, but such posts will be hidden from the Federated timeline by default. (NSFW posts from general-topic instances may still appear in the Federated timeline.)

The Mailbag suspends federation with instances that host hateful, violent, or illegal content. Members will not see such posts in their timelines, nor be able to follow accounts from suspended instances.

Federation rules are handled manually on a per-instance basis. If you find content from instances that should be limited or suspended, please report the post via the "..." button.

Support Us!

Help keep the lights on by supporting us on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/validpostage

Full Rules

  • No advertising or excessive promotion.
  • No bots, unless they're cute, funny, or useful. Bots should avoid posting to the public timeline.
  • No pornography.
  • No gore or graphic violence.
  • Content that is borderline NSFW or could be construed as NSFW at a glance should be put behind a CW (Content Warning).
  • No racism.
  • No sexism.
  • No discrimination based on gender, sexual minority, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, religion (or lack thereof), or national origin.
  • No xenophobia, nationalism, casteism, or fascism; no sympathizing with or advocating for these things.
  • No sexual depictions of children.
  • No holocaust denialism, no Nazi symbolism, no promotion of National Socialism.
  • No stalking or harassment. In general, if someone asks you to stop interacting with them, then stop.
  • Stalking, harassment, hate speech, or doxing that is posted to other instances or on other social media platforms is still grounds for having your account terminated here.
  • No posting (or threatening to post) other people's personally identifying information ("doxing").
  • No unwelcome sexual attention.
  • No public or private oppressive language or actions.
  • No promotion of conspiracy theories (eg anti-vax, anti-mask, anti-COVID).
  • No advocating for, or encouraging, any of the above behaviour.
  • No other unethical conduct.
  • No scraping content from web interface or API.

To protect the free speech of users belonging to marginalized groups, validpostage.com does not federate with overtly fascist instances. Additionally, we will refuse to federate with instances that themselves choose to federate with fascist instances.

Handling harassment

If you are being harassed, please report the user using the "…" button and then "Report." For urgent concerns, please DM Esther.

If you engage in harassing behavior, the moderator may take any action they deem appropriate, such as a warning or an expulsion.

The above rules may change at any time, and you may be banned at any time based on the moderators' judgment.

Privacy policy

What will we do with your data? Nothing. How will you be influenced by advertisers? You won't. How will we aggregate your data in order to improve your service… none of that.

We will never share your data with anyone else, except in the case of valid legal requests if it comes to that. (Hopefully it won't come to that!) Similarly, users and third parties are forbidden from scraping content from the instance's web interface or API; you are required to respect robots.txt files.

More privacy measures on validpostage.com:

  • HTTPS is used everywhere thanks to Let's Encrypt.
  • No ads or trackers.
  • Links are direct URLs rather than tracking redirects.
  • Understand though that this instance is run by Esther, and (as is the case with all Mastodon servers) she potentially have access to your data, including DMs. The back-end is also not encrypted. If this is not okay with you, this might not be the instance for you.

(For truly private data sent between two people, Mastodon offers no E2E encryption. Use Signal for the things you really want to be private.)

info.full_description:
About this Instance

A Mastodon instance for SRE/DevOps/Systems Engineers/Administrators.

Attributions

This instance has a number of emotes from Twitch Interactive. These emotes, are property of Twitch Interactive.

Code of Conduct

Short Version

We try to handle moderation ASAP, but we may not see reports for several hours. We will get to all reports though!

We're not a free speech absolutist instance, and there are instances available for that. We're not interested in hate speech of any sort, which we will define at our sole discretion as moderators. No homophobia, transphobia, queerphobia, racism allowed.

Please keep in mind that your actions reflect upon the whole server. It takes no effort to be kind.

Long Version

Borrowed and modified from the tech.lgbt instance information

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of sysad.ninja; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

  1. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:
    1. Excessive advertising
    2. Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
    3. Untagged nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions. These should be marked as sensitive and with a CW. See below.
    4. Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions. These should be marked as sensitive and with a CW. See below.
  2. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
    1. Racism or advocation of racism
    2. Sexism or advocation of sexism
    3. Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
    4. Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism
  3. The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
    1. Sexual depictions of children
    2. Content illegal in Germany and/or France
    3. Holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism
    4. Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism
  4. Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:
    1. Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
    2. Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
    3. Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.

These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

Content Warnings and Sensitive Images

Content Warnings (CWs) are a feature of Mastodon that enable you to hide the body of a "toot" (post) behind a line of text. The intended use of this feature is to provide a way to discuss sensitive and/or potentially harmful topics without causing duress or harm to anyone who might stumble upon it, though it may be used for many other things.

Images can be marked as sensitive; this is a feature which hides an image until a warning banner is clicked. Images may be marked as sensitive separately from Content Warnings, though using a Content Warning automatically marks the toot's images as sensitive.

Clearly communicated and accurately labeled content warnings and sensitive image settings are required when having public conversations involving any of the following topics or content:

  • Sexual or Adult content
  • Detailed descriptions of harassment as outlined above in the definitions of harassment
  • Political Commentary of any kind
  • Drugs or Drug Use
  • Advertisements for Corporations
  • "Rage" toots and Toots using exclusively capital letters
  • Excessively Long Toots (longer than ~15-20 lines)

In general, think about if what you are posting could cause people distress. Not the average person, mind. If a person could reasonably have PTSD or an adverse reaction, It's proper mastodon etiquette to place it behind a content warning.

Staff

This instance is administered by the site owner, @aetaric. Additional moderation support provided by:

Admins: @simon@sysad.ninja

  • DM @aetaric if you think you have qualifications worthy of being a moderator.

Antifascist/LGBTQ+/Equality/Democracy
info.full_description:
(server thumbnail by @parktroopers on unsplash)

Introduction

Hello. Welcome to misfittoys.social, a microblogging Fediverse instance operated by a member of the LGBTQ+ community who struggles with mental health issues and who values compassion, respect, and freedom.

Let me share with you my vision for this lowly little Mastodon instance. I picture a place where we all strive to be respectful of each other and offer compassion and solace to one another. None of us are perfect, and we all make mistakes or say things we might’ve phrased a little differently given the chance. I’m not looking to cancel anyone; but I’m also not looking to coddle fascism cloaked in patriotism, unbridled capitalism, intolerance, or disrespect. Just follow the rules and most importantly don’t feed the trolls. This is a “living document”, and is subject to revision at any time.

If:

I suppose I should describe the type of candidate I seek to join me on this journey. Maybe something like this: If you've ever felt like an outsider, or you don't belong, or that you don't fit in, or can't be your true self; if you've sensed that your best is never really good enough, or that it's never going to actually "get better"; if you're appalled by the stunning lack of equality, empathy, and inclusion of our society; if you believe that everyone should be allowed to have a meaningful, fulfilling, reasonable quality of life; if you're certain that every person's worth should be determined by more than just their ability (or lack thereof) to earn monetary income; if you run out of spoons way too early, if you get burned out way too fast, or get hurt far too easily; if you're filled with wonder during those brief glimpses out of depression or pain or adversity; if you feel heartbreak every time someone tells you to "just choose to be happy"; if you struggle just to stay alive; if you relate to all of these things, or some of these things, or none of these things, but are capable of showing love, kindness and compassion to your fellow users, then you’re the type of person I’m looking for.

tldr;(too long didn't read)? I wish to make friends with LGBTQIA+, marginalized BIPOC, the disenfranchised, the downtrodden. I need to network with people who are tactful and champion kindness, compassion, and the dignity of others. I seek people who approach mutual aid with respect and empathy rather than dismissiveness or derision.

Still tldr;? If you’re a misfit with a kind heart, smash the sign-up button.

Freedom of Speech

As a U.S. citizen, I believe in and support freedom of speech. But I also believe that free speech doesn’t mean freedom from consequences. I also comprehend that the first amendment is referring to government overreach. At this time, this is a private server owned by a private person. Just like Twitter, Facebook, even AOL or CompuServe are free to suspend or deny service to users who abuse the rules, I will not hesitate to enforce the rules. This means that if you wish to patronize this Mastodon instance, I expect you to behave with at least a modicum of grace and respect for those with whom you encounter as you go about your time here on misfitToys.social. Please use content warnings where applicable and try to include ALT text whenever possible.

Verboten

Forbidden activities which may result in suspension of access include, but are not limited to: content or discussion of illegal activities, NSFW without appropriate content warnings, racism, sexism, ageism, classism, harassment, or discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex (including gender identity, sexual orientation, and pregnancy), national origin, immigration status, mental health, physical health, disability, or any other legally protected characteristics.

Reporting and moderation

(The following is essentially plagiarized almost verbatim from mastodon.social) When reporting accounts, please make sure to include at least a few posts that show rule-breaking behavior, when applicable. If there is any additional context that might help make a decision, please also include it in the comment. This is especially important when the content includes a language in which no one on the moderation team is fluent.

We strive to handle reports within 24 hours. Please note that you are not notified when a report may have led to a punitive action, and that not all punitive actions are externally visible. For first time offenses, we may opt to delete offending content, escalating to harsher measures on repeat offenses.

Federation

We reserve the right to federate or defederate from any ActivityPub instance or source at any time. We are particularly averse to fascism, nazism, or religious extremism. This server was launched with liberal-leaning, progressive ideals in mind.

Location and Other Information

Both the server and user data are currently stored in California, USA. Media content is stored on a global CDN. Server and user data are backed up daily. Our primary (but not sole) language is English. This Mastodon server is not affiliated with any commercial entity.

Finances and Funding

It is our goal to be as honest and transparent in discussing any monetary issues or topics. We welcome your assistance whether financially or in-kind.

👋 Herzlich willkommen auf unserer Mastodon-Instanz!

🇫🇮 Wir freuen uns, dich auf unserer kleinen Mastodon-Community zu begrüßen. Ein herzlicher Gruß aus dem wunderschönen Finnland! 🌲🇫🇮
